In the reti , CDH23 is located in the inner segment, connecting cilia, and basal body complex, as well as the ribbon sy pses of rod and cone photoreceptor cells (40429749).
Fam166b and Ccdc33 were found to be strongly restricted to the ciliary axoneme (29180514).
CCDC34 has localized in flagella.
CCDC113, CCDC96, C4orf47, CCDC38, C7orf31, CCDC146, CCDC81 and CCDC116 as centrosome-associated proteins(25074808).

Gene Description: coiled-coil domain 39 molecular ruler complex subunit [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:25244]
Functio l Summary from Literature: CCDC39 regulates centriole/deuterosome amplification and multiciliogenesis. CCDC39/40 protein complex might define the binding site of radial spokes along peripheral microtubules and provide anchoring sites for inner dynein arms (29317443). It is essential for assembly of inner dynein arms and the dynein regulatory complex (21131972, 21131974)

Gene Description: coiled-coil domain 40 molecular ruler complex subunit [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:26090]
Synonym.x: CFAP172, CILD15, FAP172, FLJ20753, FLJ32021, KIAA1640
Functio l Summary from Literature: CCDC40 is required for assembly of motile cilia. It is responsible for CCDC39 axonemal recruitment. It is important for cytoplasmic pre- assembly, axonemal targeting, and/or transport of axonemal components CCDC39, GAS11 and D LI1. Necessary for assembly of inner dynein arms, the dynein regulatory complex and plays a role in the establishment of the left- right patterning (21131974)
CCDC42 is expressed in spermatids and localizes to the manchette, the connecting piece and the tail and also expressed in somatic cells in which it localizes to the centrosome(31475146).
CCDC50 has localized in ciliary tip, primary cilia.
Ccdc57 localizes on BBs as a rotatio lly-asymmetric punctum, which polarizes away from the BF in BBs having achieved the rotatio l polarity to probably fix the BF-AO relationship.

Synonym.x: D10S170, PTC, TPC, H4, PTC1, TST1
Functio l Summary from Literature: Platelet-derived growth factor A (PDGFA) and coiled-coil domain-containing protein 6 (CCDC6) are two interactions that link Cluap1 to ciliogenesis and cancer development ( 29615496).
CCDC61 is a paralog of SAS6, XRCC4, XLF, and PAXX, CCDC61 binds to microtubules mainly via its coiled-coil domain, and associates with basal bodies and plays a role in ciliogenesis(32375023).

in Tetrahyme , loss of either FAP61 or FAP251 reduces cell swimming and affects the ciliary waveform and that RS3 is either missing or incomplete, the CSC proteins FAP61 and FAP251 build the basal substructures of radial spoke 3 in cilia(25694453).

Synonym.x: CFAP250, CILD27, DRC2, FAP250, FLJ35732, NYD-SP28
Functio l Summary from Literature: This gene encodes a protein that is required for proper cilia motility and regulation of dynein activity (24094744). Assembly and mainte nce of the protein components of the nexin- dynein regulatory complex (N- DRC) and thus the regulation of cilia motion. Maintaince of the integrity of N-DRC required for regulation of dynein-driven microtubule sliding (23991085, 29167384).

Organisation of spindle pole and centriolar satellite. It is involved in cilium formation, satellite organization, BBS4 recruitment to the primary cilium and ciliary trafficking. Overexpression induces formation of microtubule bundles, disruption of centriolar satellite organization and inhibits ciliogenesis (28235840, 31582766). Interacts with ARMC9 and TOGORAM1 (32453716). When mutated in dogs causes late onset reti l degeneration (33273526)
CCDC74A has localized in cilia.
CCDC74B has localized in cilia.
Centriole amplification mediated by deuterosome in multi-ciliated cells. Recruitment of Cep152 to the deuterosome required for centriole biogenesis.
CCDC113, CCDC96, C4orf47, CCDC38, C7orf31, CCDC146, CCDC81 and CCDC116 as centrosome-associated proteins(25074808).

Synonym.x: GRDN, HKRP1, GIV, KIAA1212, APE, FLJ10392
Functio l Summary from Literature: Conserved sig ling and scaffolding protein Girdin localizes to the proximal regions of centrioles and regulates BB positioning and ciliogenesis in Caenorhabditis elegans sensory neurons and human RPE-1 cells. Girdin depletion alters localization of the intercentriolar linker and ciliary rootlet component rootletin, and rootletin knockdown in RPE-1 cells mimics Girdin-dependent phenotypes. C. elegans Girdin also regulates localization of the apical junction component AJM-1, suggesting that in nematodes Girdin may position BBs via rootletin- and AJM-1-dependent anchoring to the cytoskeleton and plasma membrane, respectively(27623382).
CCDC91 has localized in basal body,flagella.
TTBK2 directly phosphorylates CEP83, CEP89, Rabin8, CCDC92, and DVL3 (25297623).

Synonym.x: MCAF, MCP1, MGC9434, SMC-CF, HC11, GDCF-2, SCYA2, MCP-1
Functio l Summary from Literature: Loss of LKB1 or PC1 increases CCL2 expression and peritubular macrophage numbers and promotes ciliopathy phenotypes. The Polycystic Kidney Disase (PKD) phenotype seen upon PKD1 depletion is ameliorated in the absence of cilia or tubular CCL2 ( 29925518).

PTH1R localized to the primary cilium and this ciliary localization enhances parathyroid hormone (PTH) sig ling, leading to the transcription of integrin αvβ6. Subsequently, this activates the transforming growth factor-beta (TGF-β) pathway, which induces CCN2 expression. CCN2 then contributes to extracellular matrix production, aiding in disc homeostasis and regeneration ( 30038820).

Regulator of deuterosome formation and function for the amplification of centrioles in MCCs, for docking of centrioles to the apical cell membrane (25712475). Cyclin O is required to generate the basal bodies necessary for multiple cilia formation by promoting a process of centriole assembly and maturation (25048963)

Suppressor of ciliogenesis by acting simply as a passive physical barrier and by capping the growing ends of microtubules to prevent their elongation. Regulation the assembly of subdistal appendages (SDA) core components. Has a role in regulating centrosome duplication and separation (26965371). Regulates the length of centrioles and prevents aberrant formation of primary cilia, components to a CP110 scaffold may be needed to facilitate depolymerization (21620453). Studies suggest that CP110 might control discrete functions in the centrosome cycle and constitutes a set of controls that govern the switch from centriolar to basal body function (17719545).

Roles in the folding of 尾- propeller proteins, such as G尾1, in addition to its major target proteins, actin and tubulin. Interacts with chaperonin type BBSs, including BBSs 6, 10, and 12. Mutations in CCT2 could lead to genetic reti l diseases (27645772)

USH proteins mutually interact and partially co-localize with the TRiC/CCT subunit CCT3 in the ciliary region of photoreceptor cells and ADGRV1 interacts with the CCT3 subunit of the TriC/CCT chaperonin complex (37427378).
CCT5 has localized in flagella.

High-magnification images of co-staining with 纬-tubulin (for S100尾) or acetylated-tubulin (for CD24) confirmed E1 and E2, but not E3, labelling (Fig. 3c,d,h,i insets). S100尾 was localized to the cytoplasm, whereas CD24 was expressed on the apical surface and cilia.
CD2AP/CIN85 proteins regulate ciliary length by remodeling the actin network (36754282)

Synonym.x: SCARB3, GP4, FAT, GPIV, GPIIIB, GP3B
Functio l Summary from Literature: CD36 was both targeted to sensory cilia and capable of restoring, albeit only partially, responses to pheromone(27302750).

Synonym.x: IN, HCELL, MC56, HERMES-1, HUTCH-1, ECM-III, CDW44, MIC4, H-CAM, CSPG8, PGP1, CD44R, MDU2, HUTCH-I, PGP-1, MDU3
Functio l Summary from Literature: The primary cilium is linked to OPN sig ling pathway and actin cytoskeleton pathway via CD44 and Cdc42. The primary cilium acts as an FAK regulation unit consisting of CD44 and ciliary integrin尾1 in MSCs(32339903).

pre-cystic Cd79a-Tsc1 KO tubule cells display abnormal cilia elongation as well as defective PCP, resulting in alterations in both convergent extension (CE) and oriented cell division (OCD) ( 36627370).
CD81 and CD82 localized in cilia (26585297).
CD81 and CD82 localized in cilia (26585297).

The extracellular vesicle (EV) marker TSP-6(an ortholog of mammalian CD9) localizes to the cilia region(34533135). The cells of the MCL on the IL side consisted of cluster of differentiation 9 (CD9)-positive stem/progenitor cells with or without motile cilia(35316373).
CDC14A activity in human and mouse is needed for the formation of the kinocilia in the organ of corti. Proline鈥

Neuro l differentiation, ciliary formation or D  damage repair. Studies suggest that is involved in neuro l connectivity and plasticity (25850036). Potential activity in quiescent and differentiated cells, is recruited to the basal body of the primary cilium, where in complex with APC it negatively regulates ciliary length, by destabilizing axonemal microtubules (25139956).

Specifically expressed in maturing multiciliated cells during the phase of centriole multiplication, it has been established the corresponding CDC20B protein as an essential regulator of centriole-deuterosome disengagement. Plays an essential and conserved role of in vertebrate multiciliogenesis. Function of promoting deuterosome assembly and/or activity, may contribute to activation of Separase. Involved in the production of centrioles (30405130).
The primary cilium is linked to OPN sig ling pathway and actin cytoskeleton pathway via CD44 and Cdc42(32339903).
CDC42EP5 has localized in primary cilia.

Essential tip link component required for hair-cell mechanotransduction ( 15057246). Encodes a protein of 3,354 amino acids with a single transmembrane domain and 27 cadherin repeats ( 11138009). Studies suggest that Cdh23 are required for establishing and/or maintaining the proper organisation of the stereocilia bundle ( 12121736).

siah1 and cdhr1a co-expression as well as protein localization in the reti l outer nuclear layer (ONL), and more precisely in the connecting cilium of rods and cones between 3–5 days post fertilization (dpf)(33330480).
CDHR3 expression in cilia of bronchial epithelial cells, CDHR3 functions in the airways and link CDHR3 asthma-risk genotype to increased RV-C binding and replication(30916989).
Cdk1 phosphorylates Sas-4 to initiate Polo/Plk1 recruitment to daughter basal bodys (27326932) and localized to flagella (25613900)

Interacts with Cyclin M (CycM), encoded by FAM58A to form an active protein ki se. CDK10/CycM is a key repressor of ciliogenesis through the regulation of RhoA and modulation of actin dy mics (27104747). Important for normal regulation of ciliogenesis (29130579).

Downstream of MCC fate acquisition, Cdk2 is required to initiate and maintain the MCC gene expression program during ciliogenesis. Consistently, MCCs driven to differentiate in the absence of Cdk2 activity fail to undergo ciliogenesis (30152757). CDK2 localized to basal body (25613900)
Positively and negatively controls both ciliary length and the activity of the Hh pathway, regulates a broad array of processes at levels ranging from the subcellular to the organismal (28817564).

Gene Description: CDK5 regulatory subunit associated protein 2 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:18672]
Functio l Summary from Literature: SPD-5, the functio l homologue of CDK5RAP2, is essential for embryonic mitosis and SPD-5 is the primary driver of MTOC function at the PCM and endogenous SPD-5 localized to the ciliary base (CB) of all ciliated sensory neurons(33798428)

CDK6, together with its cyclin partner cyclin D3, enrich at the ciliary base in RPE-1 cells and an uncanonical CDK6 activity inhibits cilia function by suppressing axoneme polyglutamylation(PMID: 39636239).

DYF-18 is an evolutio rily conserved CDK7/CCRK/LF2p-related serine/threonine ki se that is necessary for the proper function of intraflagellar transport, a process critical for cilium biogenesis ( 21740898).

Gene Description: cyclin dependent ki se like 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:1781]
Functio l Summary from Literature: C. elegans CDKL-1, most closely related to CDKL1鈥

Functio l Summary from Literature: C. elegans CDKL-1, most closely related to CDKL1鈥

Functio l Summary from Literature: C. elegans CDKL-1, most closely related to CDKL1鈥

Functio l Summary from Literature: C. elegans CDKL-1, most closely related to CDKL1鈥

Gene Description: cyclin dependent ki se like 5 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:11411]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Regulate cilium length, has a potential role in ciliogenesis, facilitates dendritic spine and excitatory sy pse formation (29420175).

Gene Description: cyclin dependent ki se inhibitor 1B [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:1785]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Also known as p27Kip1. Multifunctio l protein that plays crucial roles in cell architecture and migration by regulating rearrangements of the actin cytoskeleton and microtubules. p27Kip1 abrogation impairs one of the earliest events of ciliogenesis, docking of the Ehd1- associated preciliary vesicles to the distal appendages of the basal body (32423824)

Gene Description: cyclin dependent ki se inhibitor 2B [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:1788]
Synonym.x: MTS2, CDK4I, INK4B, P15INK4B, TP15, P15
Functio l Summary from Literature: MST1/2 has a noncanonical function: regulation of microtubule stability/dy mics. Loss of MST1/2 or its target(s) NDR1/2 destabilizes kinetochore-microtubule attachment during mitosis ( 20171103 ,  19327996). MST1/2 binds and phosphorylates AURKA, leading to dissociation of the AURKA/HDAC6 cilia-disassembly complex, and MST1/2-SAV1 associates with the NPHP transition-zone complex, promoting ciliary localization of multiple ciliary cargoes ( 25367221).

Gene Description: cell adhesion associated, oncogene regulated [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:17104]
Functio l Summary from Literature: At the far periphery, ciliary margin (CM) markers Otx1 and Cdon together with Wnt3a and Fzd1 were ectopically upregulated, whereas neuroreti l progenitor markers Sox2, Notch1, and Otx2 were absent or reduced ( 30485816).

Gene Description: chromatin licensing and D  replication factor 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:24576]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Depletion of ORC1, ORC4, ORC6, CDT1 and CDC6 resulted in dramatically impaired cilia formation similar to ORC1-deficient patient cells ( 23516378).

Gene Description: cadherin EGF LAG seven-pass G-type receptor 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:1850]
Functio l Summary from Literature: In Celsr1-deficient mice, the ciliary motion is not orchestrated along the ovary-uterus axis and the transport ability of beating cilia is impaired ( 25406397).

Gene Description: cadherin EGF LAG seven-pass G-type receptor 2 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:3231]
Synonym.x: EGFL2, KIAA0279, FLAMINGO1, MEGF3, ADGRC2, CDHF10
Functio l Summary from Literature: Has been shown to be required for ciliogenesis ( 27894351). Lack of cadherins Celsr2 and Celsr3 impairs ependymal ciliogenesis, leading to fatal hydrocephalus ( 29420175), Whereas i ctivation of Celsr2, Celsr3, Fzd3, and Vangl2 perturbs the organization of ependymal multicilia at the single-cell level ( 25024228).

Gene Description: cadherin EGF LAG seven-pass G-type receptor 3 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:3230]
Synonym.x: EGFL1, ADGRC3, FMI1, CDHF11, HFMI1, MEGF2
Functio l Summary from Literature: Lack of cadherins Celsr2 and Celsr3 impairs ependymal ciliogenesis, leading to fatal hydrocephalus ( 29420175), controls the function of ependymal cilia ( 29327175), Whereas i ctivation of Celsr2, Celsr3, Fzd3, and Vangl2 perturbs the organization of ependymal multicilia at the single-cell level ( 25024228).
Centriolar disease gene implicated in severe human ciliopathy and MCPH-related phenotypes (25564561, 26820108, 31488893, 31953238).

Synonym.x: BM032, CPAP, LAP, LIP1, MCPH6, SAS-4, SASS4, SCKL4
Functio l Summary from Literature: Acts as a scaffold for the cilium disassembly complex, which includes Nde1, Aurora A, and OFD1, which is recruited to the ciliary base for timely cilium disassembly, plays a role in NPC proliferation, cilia formation, controlling the cilium axoneme and BB structure, regulates centriole duplication and elongation (30626697). Promotes the extension of the centriolar cylinder, presumably via its ability to recruit tubulin to the  scent structure, studies propose that functions as a scaffold for tubulin addition (19481458).
CENPV is deubiquitylated by CYLD and localizes in interphase to primary cilia where it increases the ciliary levels of acetylated 伪-tubulin(31260673).

Synonym.x: CFAP256, GLYBP, JBTS25, KIAA0562, ROC22, RP1-286D6.4
Functio l Summary from Literature: Has an important role in regulating microtubule length in cilia by facilitating tubulin addition to ciliary microtubules and might also be involved in regulating other factors, possibly by interacting with Nek1. Cep104 is involved in the stabilization of the ciliary axoneme or in cilia formation and elongation, mutations cause ciliopathies (28017521). Regulates ciliary assembly by interacting with centriolar proteins that suppress cilia formation, detaches from these proteins at the onset of cilia formation and moves to the tip of the  scent cilium (23970417).
CEP112 positioned radially close to the basal body center, with a second population at the daughter centriole, and axially in the same region of other basal foot proteins (33038334).

Is essential for the recruitment of C2CD3 and Talpid3 to the  scent centrioles, and is responsible for promoting the assembly of the centriole appendages that are needed for subsequent ciliogenesis. It is a daughter centriole- enriched protein that plays an essential role in centriole elongation (30988386). Plays a key role in the duplication and maturation of centrioles, which in principle could impact the production of a functio l basal body (29847808).

Cep126 localised to the centrosome in a microtubule-independent manner and CEP126 is a regulator of microtubule organisation at the centrosome that acts through modulation of the transport of pericentriolar satellites, and consequently, of the organisation of cell structure(24867236).

It encodes a subdistal appendage protein that regulates TGF-尾/bone morphogenetic protein (BMP) sig ling and RAB11 trafficking at the primary cilium. It has no major effect on centrosome structure but leads to increased ciliation frequency (29514088).

Contributor to ciliogenesis in certain tissues in the developing vertebrate embryo, involved in assembling the cilium and in determi tion of the length of the axoneme (19254375). The Atoh1- Cep131-CS integrity axis would act as a gatekeeper during GNPs鈥

CEP135/Bld10 promotes the assembly and stability of the centriolar microtubule wall. Induces the formation of protofilament-based ring-like structures, binding directly to tubulin, protofilaments, and microtubules (27477386). Required for centriole conversion to centrosome (26595382). Plays an important role in the assembly of centriole/basal bodies and stabilisation of microtubules, maintaining basal body integrity (23810536, 23115304, 22898782). Knockdown of CEP135 leads to disorganised interphase and mitotic spindle microtubules (22521416)
NCS1 and C3ORF14 proteins localized at the distal appendage (36711481).
Drosophila asterless and vertebrate Cep152 Are orthologs essential for centriole duplication(18854586) . Cep152 interacts with Plk4 and is required for centriole duplication(21059850).

Promotes and restricts transition zone (TZ) assembly before ciliogenesis. Interacts with core TZ components CEP290 and mediates their association with MTs. Loss of CEP162 arrests ciliogenesis at the stage of TZ assembly, gain of CEP162 at cilia tips promotes ectopic assembly of TZ components

Assembly of primary cilia and promotes vesicular docking and trafficking that initiates cilia membrane biogenesis (17954613, 23253480). CEP164 promotes accumulation of GTP-Rab8 at the centrosome, providing a molecular link connecting the M-centriole to components of the machinery that initiate ciliary membrane biogenesis (23253480). Recruitment of active tau tubulin ki se 2 (TTBK2) to centrioles, leading to removal of CP110 and recruitment of intraflagellar transport proteins (24982133). Mutations in CEP164 are related to nephronophthisis and Joubert syndrome, it may may facilitate the docking of the INPP5E鈥揚DE6D complex to the centrosomal distal appendage/transition fiber (23150559). Mutations also reported in a BBS/PCD case (32367404).
Protein complexes: CEP164-TTBK2 complex, CCDC92-CEP164 complex, CEP164-DZIP1 complex, Distal appendage

Functio l Summary from Literature: Required for anchoring the subdistal appendages (SDA) complex in the centrifuge to the cytoplasmic microtubule network. It is an FHDC1 buinding protein to keep this connection (29742020). Recruits microtubule-depolymerizing factor KIF2A to disassemble cilium (31197141).

Recruitment of ciliary vesicles to the centrioles during early ciliogenesis, which suggest it is a regulator for membrane trafficking pathways . CEP19 recruits and associates with RABL2 to the basal body, promoting cilia assembly via its interactions with the FT-B complex (28659385). CEP19-RABL2B complex plays a critical role as a regulator to initiate intraflagellar transport (28625565, 28428259).

Plk4 clearly colocalized with Cep192 or Cep152, albeit with only a small fraction of their sig ls . Cep192 and Cep152 competitively interacted with the cryptic polo box of Plk4 through their homologous N-termi l sequences containing acidic-伪-helix and N/Q-rich motifs(24277814).

Synonym.x: C16ORF63, DKFZP686N1651, FLJ31153, FOPNL, FOR20, PHSECRG2
Functio l Summary from Literature: Regulation of integrity of the centriole distal end and membrane anchoring. Complex with OFD1 to initiate ciliogenesis and control cilia length (26643951). Involved in cilia formation and regulating the interaction of PCM1 satellites with microtubules and motors (20551181). Regulates the assembly and maintains the stability and dy mics of microtubules. It may inhibit tubulin assembly by sequestering soluble tubulin (28694353).

Interact with proteins implicated in rhodopsin trafficking (NEK2 and NINL). Rrecruitment of several proteins to centriole proximal ends, including Girdin (Girders of actin filaments) and proteins that associate with the distal region of the mother centriole (NEK2, ninein, CEP170, p150glued and KIF2A) (30421101). C- P1 anchores rootletin filaments that hold duplicated centrosomes together(28100636). Mutations are associated to Usher Syndrome and retinitis pigmentosa (28005958).

Synonym.x: 3H11AG, BBS14, CT87, FLJ13615, JBTS5, KIAA0373, LCA10, MKS4, NPHP6, POC3, RD16, SLSN6
Functio l Summary from Literature: Assembly and stabilisation of the primary cilium as well as centrosomal function (30478281, 22563985). Interacts with a centriolar satellite protein PCM-1 and is implicated in molecular pathways related to BBS4 function. CEP250 binds PCM- 1 and are involved in ciliary targeting of Rab8 required to promote ciliogenesis. Interacts with components of both dynein and kinesin motor machineries (18772192). Regulation of intracellular protein trafficking by association with microtubule-based transport protein RPGR (16632484). CEP250 plays an important role in the formation and stabilisation of the primary cilium as well as centrosomal function, stabilises the linkage of axoneme microtubules to the ciliary membrane to maintain the integrity of the ciliary diffusion barrier. CEP290 is critical for positioning the molecular components that are necessary for correct processing of Shh sig lling in the primary cilium (30478281)
Protein complexes: CCP110-CEP290 complex, CEP290-IQCB1 complex, CC2D2A-CEP290 complex, Distal appendage

Functio l Summary from Literature: Also calles CAP350. Facilitates the localization of CEP19 to the centriole (28659385). CEP250 is necessary for recruitment of FOP and provides a docking site for it at the centrosome. Both CEP250 and FOP form a complex and are required for microtubules anchoring to the centrosome (16314388). CEP350-FOP complex promotes recruitment of both the CEP19-RABL2B complex and TTBK2 to the mother centriole (28625565). Centriole growth is regulated by CAP350, which is also required early during the procentriole assembly process when the first microtubule is polymerised (19052644)

Regulation of tubulin glutamyl posttranslatio l modifications by mediating ciliary transport of TTLL6 between the basal body and cilium, therefore, it is also required for localising TTLL6 to the cilium. CEP41 is also involved in ciliary structural formation and motility through glutamylation and its loss of CEP41 has been identified as a cause of Joubert syndrome (22246503). CEP41 regulates cilia disassembly and angiogenesis through AURKA activation by modulating axonemal tubulin glutamylation (31885126)
CEP43 has localized in basal body.
CEP44 has localized in cilia.
CEP55 has localized in basal body, transition zone.
The Cep63 co-localized with Cep152 and associated laterally with  scent centrioles(24240477).

Connection of the two centrosomes of a cell during interphase, required for cilia and mitotic spingle formation. Rootletin binds CEP68 modulating the thickness of rootletin filaments and promoting rootletin filament formation. Rootletin and CEP68 rings are the anchoring point of filaments that radiate into the cytoplasm (29463719). CEP68, C- P1 and Rootletin, cooperate in centrosome cohesion (18042621). Interacts with CEP215 to retain it on the peripheral pericentriolar material, inhibiting centriole separation following disengagement (25503564)

The ciliary function of CYLD is partially attributed to its deconjugation of the polyubiquitin chain from centrosomal protein of 70 kDa (Cep70), a requirement for Cep70 to interact with 纬-tubulin and localize at the centrosome(25342559).

Regulation of the centrosomal localisation of γ-tubulin complex components, CG- P, and Kiz. Cep72 provides centrosomal microtubule-nucleation activity and has critical roles in spindle-pole formation, whichis needed for proper tension generation between sister chromatids during mitosis (19536135). Recruitment of Cep290 to centriolar satellites by interaction with PCM1. Regulates ciliary recruitment and relocalisation of BBS4 from centriolar satellites to primary cilia during ciliogenesis, which affects assembly and recruitment of the BBSome (22767577).

The eukaryotic ciliary/centriolar TGLs are included both catalytically active (mainly from the CCDC135 clade) and i ctive versions (mostly from the CEP76 and CC2D2A/MKS6 clades) key ciliary/centrosomal proteins(22983010).

Centrosome overduplication by interaction with the N- termi l catalytic domain of Plk4 (27246242). Regulation of centrosome homeostasis by inhibiting the fi l step of the enzymatic reaction catalyzed by EDD鈥

Recruitment of distal appendages proteins like SCLT1 and CEP89 (23348840). CEP83 phosphorylation mediated by TTBK2, regulates docking of membrane vesicles to mother centrioles, promoting CP110 removal and cilia initiation. Mutation have been associated with infantile nephronophthisis (31455668).

Cep85 is a bo  fide Nek2A-binding partner that surrounds the proximal ends of centrioles where it cooperates with PP1纬 (also known as PPP1CC) to antagonize Nek2A activity in order to maintain the centrosome integrity in interphase in mammalian cells (26220856).
C6ORF204 localized to centrosome().

Also calles CEP13 and CCDC123. Assembly of primary cilium and membrane docking (23348840). It interacts with the centriolar satellite proteins PCM-1 and OFD1 for cilia formation, and with Cep290 for the recruitment of membranes to the centrosome. CEP123 is required for the formation of a ciliary vesicle at the distal end of the mother centriole during primary ciliogenesis (23789104)
CCDC45 localized to centrosome().

Recruitment and stabilisation of CP110 to centrosomes. Both CP110 and CEP97 complexes regulate basal body function, centrosome functions and inhibit cilia assembly (17719545). Loss of CEP97 causes premature cilia formation or abnormal centriole elongation (30375385). CEP97 ubiquitylation and degradation play a key role in the removal of the CEP97–CP110 complex from the mother centriole for initiating ciliary axoneme extension (30404837).
Cerkl localized to axonemes (29180514).
CERS5 has localized in ciliary tip, primary cilia.
CES3,Foxj1-induced genes, localized along the extracellular shafts of the motile cilia (25139857).
CEP290 and CETN1 similarly overlap at the wildtype connecting cilium and CETN1 accumulation in the Cetn2,Cetn3 central connecting cilium (30647131).

Synthesis and accumulation of CETN2 is required for centriole duplication (12176356). Regulation of primary ciliogenesis through controlling CP110 levels and localisation (25753040). Stabilisation of connecting cilium axoneme structure. CETN2 is required for photoreceptor survival by regulating SPATA7 CC localization, distal connecting cilium/axoneme microtubule stability, and outer segment disc orientation (30647131)

CETN3 is also required for photoreceptor survival by regulating SPATA7 CC localization, distal connecting cilium/axoneme microtubule stability, and outer segment disc orientation (30647131). CETN3 restrains centriole assembly by inhibiting Mps1 ki se activity at centrosomes and phosphorylation of both the specific substrate CETN2 (26354417)

ankef1a, odf3l2a, and saxo2 have distinct distribution patterns within the kinocilium (37367482).

Promotes primary cilia disassembly through the activation of Aurora A ki se. Depletion increases ciliated cells and cilia length in reti l pigment epithelium cells. Regulation of localization of Pcdh15a to the apical aspect of hair cells, contributing to the assembly and/or function of the mechanotransduction apparatus. Cilia protein required for cilia formation. Key regulator of hedgehog sig ling and as an intraflagellar transport B complex protein involved in anterograde and retrograde cilia transport. Deletion of Cluap1 causes a total loss of cilia within the developing embryo in mice (23351563, 31554018, 23742838). Role in cilia assembly and mainte nce, intracellular transport processes and cytoskeletal rearrangement by its interactions with TRIP6, which is suggested to be an actin and migration- modulating factor (29615496 )

Mice with a null mutation in Efcab1, which encodes calaxin, display typical phenotypes of primary ciliary dyskinesia, including hydrocephalus, situs inversus, and abnormal motility of trachea cilia and sperm flagella. The 9 + 2 axonemal structures of epithelial multicilia and sperm flagella are normal, but the formation of 9 + 0 nodal cilia is significantly disrupted. Knockout of calaxin in zebrafish also causes situs inversus due to the irregular ciliary beating of Kupffer鈥檚 vesicle cilia, although the 9 + 2 axonemal structure appears to remain normal(31240264)., CLXN is an outer dynein arm-docking complex鈥揳ssociated component. CLXN functions as an ODA-DC subunit in human respiratory cilia especially involved in the docking of distal type 2 ODAs(36727596).

Gene Description: ciliogenesis and pla r polarity effector complex subunit 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:25801]

JBTS17 contributes to mitotic progression by interacting with LIS1, its depletion disrupts chromosome alignment and spindle pole orientation, resulting in mitotic delay (31004438). JBTS17 acts upstream of NPHP1 in the assembly of the NPHP1-4-8 complex in the cilia transition zone, it is required for efficient SHH sig ling and for establishing cell polarity (25877302).

Component of the CPLANE complex and acts at increasing the efficiency of primary cilia initiation in a late step. RSG1 activity promotes assembly of the microtubule axoneme after the mother centriole has docked onto the ciliary vesicle and accelerates the rate of elongation of the young axoneme. Only gene identified to date in which null mutations cause the production of fewer primary cilia of normal length and without a detectable defect in ciliary trafficking (29038301)

Component of ciliogenesis pathways. Studies suggest that GPCRs may regulate endocytic membrane trafficking, playing sensory or sig lling roles in the ciliary vesicle or procilium at the earliest stages of ciliogenesis both in the developing brain and in other tissues.

Structural component of the ciliary rootlet. Coiled-coil interaction in the extended α-helical rod domain of rootletin is a key feature in rootlet formation (12427867). Interaction between the rootlet and intermediate filaments may contribute substantially to the role as support structure for the cillium. Candidate gene for human reti l degeneration (15870283). interacts with the large coiled-coil protein, C- P1, to connect parental centrioles and maintain centrosome cohesion. Positive regulation of ciliogenesis (23070519). Cystin may not involved in a ciliogenic pathway, but would rather play a novel role in ciliary function. It bounds to the axonemal membrane and may function as part of a molecular scaffold that stabilizes microtubule assembly within the ciliary axoneme (11854326).

Important or cilia beat generation. Loss of LRRC50 affects the assembly of proximally and distally located ODA complexes. Candidate for human cystic kidney disease (19944400)

Highly conserved WD-repeat protein which acts as part of a chaperone complex involved in pre-assembly of axonemal dynein in the cytoplasm. Required for motile ciliogenesis in pla rian Schmidtea mediterranea, knockdowns have partial loss of dynein arms (26912790). Works with the D AF Spag1 at a distinct stage in dynein preassembly to regulate cytoplasmic pre- assembly of ciliary dynein in Drosophila (29743191). Functions with the HSP90 co-chaperone R2TP-like complex and other D AFs in axonemal dynein preassembly in the cytoplasm of Chlamydomo s (30428028). Stablises axonemal dynein heavy chains in cytoplasm in Chlamydomo s (31116681)

D AF2 localized to basal body (25613900).

Component of outer dynein arm (PMID:15937072, 11175280, 29843777). Heterotaxy candidate gene, involved in left-right patterning regulaton by affecting the notochord. Participates in protozoan flagellar motility (29843777)

Component of axonemal inner dynein arm-f, essential for ciliary beat (30060180). D H2 mutation can cause severe sperm flagella defects that damage sperm motility (30811583).
D h3 knockout (KO) male mice were also infertile, especially showing the severe reduction in sperm movement with the abnormal inner dynein arms and mitochondrion structure (39503742).

Putative inner dynein arm component. Required for ciliogenesis and motile cilia function mediating airway clearance and left/right patterning. Mutations can cause heterotaxy and ciliary dysfunction similar to primary ciliary dyskinesia by disruption of cilia ultrastructure (26918822)
Axonemal inner arm component of human cilia. Absent in primary ciliary dyskinesia (11877439)

D H17 and D H8, but not D H5, D H9, or D H11, colocalize with α-tubulin along the sperm axoneme, whereas the reverse picture is observed in respiratory cilia, thus explaining the phenotype restricted to sperm cells (31178125).

Functio l Summary from Literature: Component of ciliary outer dynein arms and is required in cilia motility and ODA stability. In individuals with pathogenic variants in D H11, D H9 can reside in the place of D H11. Mutations confer a loss of ODAs in the distal portion of the ciliary axoneme and affects the ciliary beat pattern (30471717). Essential in distal axonemal assembly and docking of ODAs type 2, which occurs via direct interaction of D H9 with the docking complex protein CCDC114 (30471718)

Axonemal outer dynein intermediate-chain protein. Mutations result in primary ciliary dyskinesia with situs solitus or situs inversus (11231901). D I and D I2 form a complex essential for the stability of both proteins during early stages of outer dynein arms assembly (29113992)

Outher dynein arm intermediate chain protein. D I and D I2 form a complex essential for the stability of both proteins during early stages of outer dynein arms assembly (29113992). Essential for axonemal assembly of the ODA heavy chains D H5 and D H9 (18950741). Required for ODA formation in Kupffer's Vesicle cilia and controls the stablishment of left-right doby axis and kidney formation through regulation of ciliary motility.(20709053, 20707998)

Vertebrate orthologue of Chlamydomo s intermediate chain inner dynein arm protein IC140 which localises to Chlamydomo s flaggelar axoneme (9843573). In Chlamydomo s interacts with IC138 (WDR78 in vertebrates) and directly interacts with tubulin (24080090). Associates with inner dynein arm subunit Wdr78 in mice (30060180). Rare intragenic heterozygous in-frame WDR63 deletion identified as likely cause of occipital encephalocele in one human fetus (29285825). Similar mutations in zebrafish caused similar malformations (29285825). Also interacts with Arp2/3 to regulate actin polymerisation and inhibit cell migration, invasion, and metastasis (32128961)

Identified as a putative cilia gene by proteomics and comparative genomics (15937072), characterised as a cilia protein via siR  knockdown of Wdr78 in 3 different mouse cell lines and high content imaging which showed perturbed receptor transport to the ciliary membrane and HH sig lling (21289087). Vertebrate orthologue of Chlamydomo s inner dynein arm protein IC138. Associates with inner dynein arm subunits such as D h2 (a heavy chain) and Wdr63 (Chlamydomo s IC140 orthologue) in mice. Localises specifically to motile cilia in mice and knockdown leads to immotility of ependymal cilia with failure of heavy chains and intermediate chains of inner dynein arms to localise to motile cilia 30060180 . Zebrafish Wdr78 morphants have ciliopathy- type phenotypes (30060180).

Daam1 knockdown within these mammalian kidney epithelial cells result in the formation of fewer cilia. Ciliogenesis in MDCKII cells depends on the formin activity of Daam1. In MDCKII and IMCD3 cells Daam1 localizes to vesicles that carry ciliary components(31469868).

DCC has localized in primary cilia ,basal body.

Functio l role in ciliary sig ling . DCDC2 overexpression increases ciliary length and enhances the Kif3a mediated translocation of Smo to the cilium, resulting in overactivation of the Shh pathway in neurons (21698230). Regulation of microtubule nucleation, stability and length in hair cells (25601850). Overexpression inhibits 尾- catenin-dependent Wnt sig ling (25557784)
DCDC2C has localized in flagella.

DCTN1 has localized in primary cilia ,basal body

Mutations in DDX59 cause an autosomal-recessive form of orofaciodigital syndrome, nevertheless, normal ciliogenesis is observed.

The dihydroceramide desaturase DEGS1/2 ortholog TTM-5 is highly expressed in the EV-releasing sensory neurons, localizes to cilia, and is required for sustained but not initial ciliary EV release, implicating ceramide in ciliary ectocytosis(38838665).
Consistent with these observations, GFP-Rab35 localises to cilia, as do GEF (DENND1B) and GAP (TBC1D10A) Rab35 regulators, which also regulate ciliary length and Rab35 ciliary localisation.

Multicilin coopts the inhibitory E2fs to activate key components that drive centriole assembly during the centriolar cycle, such as Plk4, Cep152, and Stil, while also activating the expression of deup1, the paralog of cep63 required for centriole assembly via the deuterosome rather than the centriolar pathway(24240477, 24934224)
DHCR7, an enzyme that produces cholesterol, activates the Hedgehog pathway, and localizes near the ciliary base(33284321) .
In CRCs, cancer cells contained single uniformly shaped CEP250 foci that colocalized with centrosome-associated spliceosome components DHX35(37250316) .
The reciprocal ciliary localization patterns of CKAP2L and DHX57 highlighting region-specific variations in ciliary composition between the dorsal and ventral brain regions(PMID: 40654709).

Promotes both actin polymerization and EB1- dependent microtubule (MT) stability, both actin nucleating and microtubule-stabilizing properties of DIAPH1 are important for their cilia functions. Depletion of DIAPH1 decreased ciliogenesis, cilia length, and reduced trafficking within cilia. Conversely, targeting of DIAPH1 specifically to the basal body causes an increase in cilia length and increased trafficking within cilia. Thought to regulate cilia mainte nce in part by regulating vesicular trafficking to the base of the primary cilia (33124112)

Mutation in DIAPH2 in humans is linked to premature ovarian failure (POF) (26175800), and other defects in ciliogenesis have been linked to POF(21940798) . DIAPH2 and DIAPH3 have role in ciliogenesis and cilia mainte nce and depletion of DIAPH2 and DIAPH3 caused impaired ciliogenesis, decreases in cilia length, and decreases in IFT20 or Rab11 recruitment to the ciliary base(33872598).

DIAPH3 showed progressive hearing loss with profound abnormalities of inner hair cell (IHC) stereocilia (short, fused, elongated, spare) and loss of IHC ribbons ( 23441200) and DIAPH3 may coordi te vesicle trafficking to the base of cilia to regulate ciliogenesis and cilia mainte nce(33872598). DIAPH2 and DIAPH3 have role in ciliogenesis and cilia mainte nce and depletion of DIAPH2 and DIAPH3 caused impaired ciliogenesis, decreases in cilia length, and decreases in IFT20 or Rab11 recruitment to the ciliary base(33872598).
DIS3L has localized in cilia.

Regulation of the formation and/or mainte nce of primary cilia, and establish subtype-specific targeting of dopamine receptors to the ciliary surface. Interacts with centriolar and ciliary components (20531939). Ciliogenesis and intraflagellar transport regulation through MIPT3 interaction. DISC1 is involved in plus-end and minus-end microtubular transport (28125008)
DKKL1 has localized in flagella.

dmc1, which encodes an essential meiotic recombi tion protein, as the major target gene of E2f5 during spermatogenesis. E2f5 can bind to the promoter of dmc1 to promote homologous recombi tion, and overexpression of dmc1 significantly increased the fertilization rate of e2f5 mutant males ( 32196499).

Functio l Summary from Literature: In sperm from control individuals, the DNHD1 staining was present throughout the entire flagella with a high intensity in the midpiece of the sperm flagellum (36768883).

Role in ciliogenesis and tubulogenesis, acting as a guanine nucleotide exchange factor that regulates Cdc42 activity. Depletion results in an absence of cilia, with impaired apical polarisation. Controller of left-right patterning (26895965). TUBA/Cdc42/Par6A complex is required to ensure the formation of a single apical domain during enterocyte polarization ( 30408122).

Ezrin, ELMO-DOCK1 and its downstream effector Rac1 cooperate and function as a module during the highly coordi ted processes of ciliary basal body targeting and docking to the apical membrane. Co-immunostainings with Cep164 confirmed that DOCK1 localised to both mother and daughter centrioles.(25516973).

DPF3 depletion causes kinetochore fiber (K-fiber) instability, less stable kinetochore鈥搈icrotubule (KT鈥揗T) attachment and defects in chromosome alignment at the metaphase plate. DPF3 localized at the basal body of the primary cilium in quiescent vertebrate cells. Depletion of DPF3 dramatically arrested primary ciliogenesis at the initial step of axoneme extension(38661008).
Neuro l protein that guides neurite growth. Also called CRMP-2, is a GSK-3尾 substrate and a microtubule- binding protein. Required for primary cilium biogenesis.

Structural component of the nexin-dynein regulatory complex (N-DRC), critical for regulation of the dynein motors. Its integrity is essential for the regulation of ciliary beat. Mutations are a cause for an autosomal recessive variant of primary ciliary dyskinesia (23354437). DRC1 and DRC2 form a subcomplex in the cytoplasm prior to assembly into the axoneme. DRC1 and DRC2 coassemble to form a central scaffold needed for assembly of the N-DRC and its attachment to the outer doublet (29167384). Loss of function of DRC1 may weaken the N鈥怐RC and its attachment to the peripheral microtubules, leading to axonemal microtubule disorganization (31960620).

Component of N-DRC, important in flagellar motility (27261005). Studies suggest it is required for other N-DRC components to assemble into the N-DRC. Its location suggests that DRC3 could be important for transducing regulatorysig ls from the radial spokes through the base plate of the N-DRC to the dynein motor (25564608).

Central linker subunit that helps connect the N-DRC to the outer dynein arms. Loss of DRC7 causes defects in sperm storage and fertility (31659045). Essential for the correct assembly of the N-DRC and flagella, stability of the N-DRC is essential for proper axoneme elongation. DRC7 is essential to localize DRC5 in the correct place, and that DRC5 regulates flagellar motility (31961863)

Role in motile ciliary beating in ependymal cells by regulation of catecholamines. Mediation of cellular responses to distinct endogenous catecholamines, which suggests that primary cilia play a fundamental role in enhancing the selectivity of integrated catecholamine sig ling (23936473)
Regulates hormone secretion and proliferation. Plays a key role in dopaminergic regulation (21673453)
Ciliary mechanosensory protein in vascular endothelial cells. DR5 activation increases cilia length in a concentration-dependent manner and restores cilia function in the mutant cells (21709211)

(29742051).WDR60 KO cells extend axonemes but show reduced assembly of dynein-2 and binding to IFT proteins. Fgfr4 knockdown causes mispatterning of the left-right organizer (LRO) even before cilia on its surface initiate symmetry-breaking fluid flow, indicating a role in the earliest stages of LR development ( 30564136).

SPANX-A/D interacts with fumarate hydratase(FH) and colocalises with both fumarate hydratase and Tektin 1 proteins, involved in meeting energy demands for sperm motility, and with nuclear pore complex nucleoporins ( 32221341).

Coordi tion of cytoskeletal dy mics during normal cilia assembly. Interacts with CEP170 to regulare cilia elongation and inhibition of cilia assembly. Overexpression of FHDC1 induces F-actin accumulation, microtubule stabilization, blocks cilia assembly and induces cilia resorption (29742020).
Formin homology 2 domain containing 1 (Fhod1) surrounded basal bodies in a donut-like fashion, occupying the space in between basal bodies and actin filaments(35440631)
Fhod3 localized to the anterior rootlet (Fig. 3c), and additio lly labeled posterior rootlets(35440631).

Overexpressed FIGL-1 markedly disturbs ciliogenesis and the centrosome structure. Endogenous FIGL-1 localizes to the centrosome in cells, preferentially to the mother centriole. Depletion of FIGL-1 enhances ciliogenesis and slows cilia disassembly(27384458).

Transcription factor that controls motile cilia formation ( 19011630). Activates the transcription of numerous known ciliary genes and specifically regulates motile cilia biogenesis ( 30881373).
