Gene Description: hydroxy-delta-5-steroid dehydroge se, 3 beta- and steroid delta-isomerase 2 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:5218]
Functio l Summary from Literature: An enzyme that is part of sterol synthesis, HSD3B1/HSD3B2 also found in several enzymes in cilia

Gene Description: heat shock protein 90 alpha family class A member 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:5253]
Synonym.x: FLJ31884, HSP89, HSP90, HSP90N, HSPC1, HSPCA, HSPCAL4
Functio l Summary from Literature: Effector protein in the FOXJ1 regulatory network (30881373). Hsp90伪 shows chaperone activity that might facilitate protein assembly and disassembly during ciliogenesis. Phosphorylated Hsp90伪 is likely to be a component of the distal appendages in the mother centriole (25359884).

Gene Description: heat shock protein family A (Hsp70) member 1A [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:5232]
Functio l Summary from Literature: YFP-tagged HSPA6 and HSPA1A were detected in prominent structures resembling centrioles in the cytoplasm of post-mitotic, differentiating human neurons (24061851).

Gene Description: heat shock protein family A (Hsp70) member 1B [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:5233]
Functio l Summary from Literature: HSPA1B has localized in basal body,flagella.

Gene Description: heat shock protein family A (Hsp70) member 1 like [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:5234]
Functio l Summary from Literature: HSPA1L has localized in basal body,flagella.

Gene Description: heat shock protein family A (Hsp70) member 2 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:5235]
Functio l Summary from Literature: HSPA2 localized to flagella (25613900)

Gene Description: heat shock protein family A (Hsp70) member 5 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:5238]
Functio l Summary from Literature: HSPA5 localized to flagella (25613900)

Gene Description: heat shock protein family A (Hsp70) member 8 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:5241]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Also called HSC70. Function in the formation or stabilization of IFT-cargo complexes working with MRJ. It may bind directly to IFT88 or to one or more additio l TPR containing proteins within the IFT particle, which in turn recruit MRJ bound cargo proteins (19302411).

Gene Description: heat shock protein family D (Hsp60) member 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:5261]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Tetrahyme  hsp60 ( HSPD1 in Human) is localized in basal bodies and is involved in cortical patterning such as the formation of the oral apparatus as well as having a role in the folding of mitochondrial proteins in mitochondria(11260259).

Also known as 5-HT6. Regulates length, morphology and function of neuro l primary cilia through ARL13B, influences cilia and axon initial segment. Involved in cognition and Alzheimer鈥檚 disease development (28931427). E ble chemosensory functions in ciliated neurons to sense 5- HT in the immediate milieu (10432491).
A chimeric HTR7 containing the N-termi l portion of the i3 loop from HTR6 was successfully targeted to cilia (18256283).

Mutated in Huntington's Disease. Scaffolding protein required for vesicular transport via interactions with microtubules and motor protein cargo adaptors such as HAP1 and dy ctin. Functio l role in autophagy (26160070). Essential for protein trafficking to the centrosome and normal ciliogenesis. Retrograde trafficking of PCM1 regulated by HTT and HAP1 to control ciliogenesis (21985783).
Hv1 is confined to the principal piece of the sperm flagellum, where it is expressed at unusually high density (20144758).

Gene Description: HYDIN axonemal central pair apparatus protein [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:19368]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Candidate for hydrocephalus in humans and primary ciliary dyskinesia (23022101). Interacts with the central pair proteins CPC1 and kinesin- like protein 1 (KLP1). Required for flagellar motility. Regulation of contact with the radial spokes dynein arm activity (17296796). Lack of Hydin causes deficiency on ciliary orientation and reduced alignment of neighboring cilia, as it is involved in regulating the dynein arms during the transitions between effective and recovery strokes (18250199).

Gene Description: HYLS1 centriolar and ciliogenesis associated [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:26558]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Required for intraflagellar transport trafficking and for centrioles to form cilia. Loss of HYLS-1 results in severe defects in axoneme assembly and transition zone organisation, due to impaired entry of IFT machinery to the cilia via DYF-19 (28411189). Ciliogenesis mediation by regulating the formation of the ciliary gate, minor role in transition zone assembly. Required for distal centriole elongation and recruiting distal centriole proteins (32509774). Essential for the apical targeting and/or anchoring of centrioles/basal body at the plasma membrane, contributin to basal body organisation (19656802).
IDE deficiency triggers impairments in cilia formation, inducing alpha cell hyperplasia and possibly also contributing to dysregulated glucagon secretion and hyperglucago emia ( 35652923).
IDO1 has localized in ciliary tip, primary cilia.

Synonym.x: CFAP80, FAP80, SPG, WDR10, WDR10P, WDR140
Functio l Summary from Literature: Negative regulator of the Shh pathway, controlling the ciliary localization of Shh pathway activators and repressors. Loss of IFT122 causes accumulation of Gli2 and Gli3 at cilia tips. Function in retrograde intraflagellar transport (ITF) that facilitates complex A stability (21209331). Required for transport of opsin, and the distal elongation of outer segments (27681595). IFT122 connects the core and peripheral subcomplexes of the IFT-A (29220510).

Component of IFT-A complex, mutated in skeletal ciliopathies with kidney disease (23418020). Associates with IFT122 and IFT144 to a stable IFT-A core subcomplex, indispensable for dynein proteins retrograde transport into the cytoplasm and flagellar assembly. Required for development and mainte nce of outer segments, ciliary/flagellar assembly and sig l transduction (29236364, 24619649).

Component of IFT complex B. Involved in the switching between the anterograde and retrograde transport (29659833). Essential for ciliary growth and mainte nce, and morphogenesis of the cerebral cortex. Mutation cause alterations in multiple intracellular sig ling pathways (31850339, 18930042). Mutations are associated with severe skeleto-re l disorders with reti l involvement (25168386).
Protein complexes: Intraflagellar transport complex B, Intraflagellar transport complex B peripheral subcomplex

Functio l Summary from Literature: Component of IFT complex B that functions as a link between IFT complex and kinesin II, binding to both IFT57 and KIF3B, making it essential for anterograde transport in cilia and flagella (12821668). Required for ciliary assembly and localisation of polycystin-2 and opsin to cilia (16775004). Essential for spermiogenesis and male fertility (27682589).
Protein complexes: Intraflagellar transport complex B, Intraflagellar transport complex B peripheral subcomplex, Pericentrin complex

Synonym.x: CFAP9, DKFZP761N0823, FAP9, FLJ13225, FLJ14117, RABL5
Functio l Summary from Literature: Also known as RABL5, component of IFT complex B. Controls the cellular levels of both IFT鈥怉 and IFT鈥怋 proteins and to regulate availability of particles participating in IFT (30940671). Recruitment of BBSome to the basal body through BBS3 and regulation of BBSome entry into the cilia (31953262).

Synonym.x: C1ORF41, CFAP232, FAP232, HSPB11, HSPCO34, PP25
Functio l Summary from Literature: Also known as IFT25. Not required in ciliogenesis of somatic cells. Component of IFT-B complex and maight be involved in retrograde transport. Interacts with IFT27 and is indispensable for sperm flagellum axoneme formation, integrity and stability in mice, as well as contributing to the trafficking of sig lling molecules via BBSome complex. (28430876, 28964737, 30709917). Regulation of ciliary trafficking of Hh pathway components, including Patched-1, Smoothened, and Gli2 (26023097, 22595669).

Also known as RABL4, component of IFT complex B. Forms a complex with IFT25 and associates with IFT-B inside cilia, interacts with and stabilises the nucleotide-free form of ARL6 to promote the exit of BBSome out of cilia. Mutated in Bardet-Biedl syndrome (25443296). Required for BBSome trafficking essential for hedgehog sig ling. IFT25/IFT27 complex plays a role in transporting Gli2 to the ciliary tip (25446516). Role in the cargo loading of the retrograde transport machinery (24843028).

Component of IFT complex A. Mutations leads to abnormal ciliogenesis (28973684). Interacts with IFT121 to regulate stability of IFT-A, and is essential for ciliogenesis. Involved in transporting ciliary precursors from the cytoplasmic pool to the peri-basal body region (28207750)

Component of IFT complex B, required for ciliogenesis and controls cilia number and length (25722189). Plas a role in the transport of IFT proteins between the cytoplasm and cilia (29915351). IFT46 is crucial for transport of ODA16 into the flagellum, it interacts with IFT52 to assembly a subcomplex which is a prerequisite for the assembly of IFT-B1 (28701346).

Component of IFT complex B. Essential for anterograde complex integrity, biosynthesis and mainte nce of cilia. Regulation of ciliogenesis and cilia length, it also plays a role as a docking site for complex B proteins attaching to the transition fibres of the basal bodies and is required for localization of the IFT-B complex proteins (27466190). Recruits and interacts with IFT46 to assembly a subcomplex which is a prerequisite for the assembly of IFT-B1, it is also required to localise IFT46 to the basal body (28302912).

Also known as IFT56. Regulates normal levels and distribution of IFTB proteins in the cilia. Required for the accumulation of Gli2 and Gli3 at the distal tips of cilia, essential for normal microtubule architecture within the ciliary axoneme and trafficking of Shh sig ling proteins. IFT56 associates with motility factors, function results in impaired motility (28264835). Required for normal development and differentiation in reti  and pronephros (22718903). Role in transporting ciliary cargoes related to ciliary motility and for assembling cilia of full length (24596149). Forms a dimer with IFT46, responsible for the interaction of IFT-B with ARL13B (27927754).

Component of IFT complex B. Required for effective transport, outer segment mainte nce and ciliary elongation. Mediates the interaction between IFT20 and the IFT particle (18492793). Trafficking of motility-related proteins and prevents IFT particle complex from degradation (28104816).
Protein complexes: Intraflagellar transport complex B, Intraflagellar transport complex B peripheral subcomplex, Pericentrin complex

Functio l Summary from Literature: Also known as IFT70A. Component of the IFT-B complex. Crucial for interaction with IFT52鈥揑FT88 dimer in the IFT-B complex, which is required for ciliogenesis. Knockout cells do not form cilia. (296541164). Required for flagella assembly. Depletion results in the formation of short flagella (20534810).

Also known as IFT70B. Component of the IFT-B complex. Redundant roles with IFT70A. Interacts with the IFT52鈥揑FT88 dimer in the IFT-B1 subcomplex, required for ciliogenesis. Knockout cells do not form cilia. (296541164). Required for flagella assembly. Depletion results in the formation of short flagella (20534810).

Component of IFT complex B. Interacts with IFT81 to stabilise IFT-B complex. This interaction is required for binding and transport of tubulin to regulate cilium length, required for ciliogenesis (23990561). Essential for normal mouse spermatogenesis and sperm flagella formation by transporting cargo proteins and modulating axoneme and microtubule assembly (31004481).

Component of IFT complex B. Role in cilia formation and osteogenesis through regulating Hedgehog/Gli sig l pathways. Silencing IFT80 led to either shortening or loss of cilia and the decrease of cilia marker protein Arl13b expression. Mutations cause Jeune asphyxiating thoracic dystrophy (JATD) and short rib polydactyly type III (SRPIII) (22771375). Required for IFT mediated recruitment and transport of ciliary cargo, as well as for initiation of the ciliary axoneme (29658880).
Protein complexes: Intraflagellar transport complex B, Intraflagellar transport complex B peripheral subcomplex

Functio l Summary from Literature: Component of IFT complex B. Interacts with IFT74 to form a tubulin-binding module that is the main site of tubulin binding for IFT and is required for ciliogenesis. Both are essential for flagellar assembly and elongation (27068536, 23990561).

Component of IFT complex B. Required for ciliary and flagellar assembly and may play a role in the attachment of the IFT particle to its cargo or to the anterograde IFT motor FLA10-kinesin-II (11062270).
Protein complexes: Intraflagellar transport complex B, DZIP1-IFT88 complex, Pericentrin complex

Functio l Summary from Literature: C11ORF74, interacts with the IFT-A complex via the IFT122 subunit and is accumulated at the distal tip in the absence of an IFT-A subunit IFT139, suggesting that at least a fraction of C11ORF74 molecules can be transported towards the ciliary tip by associating with the IFT-A complex, although its majority might be out of cilia at steady state (30476139).
IGBP1 has localized in basal body.
IGBP1C has localized in ciliary tip, basal body, transition zone.

IGF-1 sig ls are predomi ntly transduced through IGF-1 receptor (IGF- 1R) on the cilia. Promotes cell cycle entry. Mediation of ciliary resorption through activation of IGF-1R (23954591). IGF1 mediated sig ling regulates ciliated cell differentiation (28050756).

Gene Description: insulin like growth factor 1 receptor [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:5465]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Activation of an AGS3- regulated G尾gamma sig ling pathway that subsequently recruits phospho(T94)Tctex-1 to the transition zone, leading to cilia resorption (23954591). IGF1R mediated plays a role in regulating ciliated cell differentiation (28050756).

Gene Description: Indian hedgehog sig ling molecule [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:5956]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Primary cilia modulate IHH sig l transduction in response to hydrostatic loading of growth plate chondrocytes ( 21930256)
IK is essentially involved in ciliogenesis as an upstream regulator of oral-facial-digital syndrome ciliopathy gene, ofd1 ( 37898820).
IL10RA has localized in primary cilia.

Treatment of cultured differentiated human airway epithelial tissue with IL-13 resulted in a loss of ciliated epithelial cells and an increase in mucus-secreting cells. In addition to the loss of ciliated cells and increase in mucous cells after IL-13 treatment, cells with characteristics of both ciliated and mucous cells were observed in the airway epithelium ( 17541011).

ringenin exerted its protective effect on ciliary structure and number in part via modulation of the IL-17 sig ling pathway.  ringenin prevented CSE-induced cilia damage via mechanisms such as the upregulation of inflammatory factors (e.g., IL-6, IL-8, IL-13), ROS and MDA. IL-17 sig ling pathway might be involved in the protective effect of  ringenin on airway cilia ( 38359483).
IL-1β-induces primary cilia elongation with alterations to cilia trafficking of arl13b ( 24330727).
IL-1RL2 localization was clear at expanded cilia of distal tubules epithelial cells after unilateral ureter obstruction (29109726).

Interleukin-1 (IL-1) stimulates ciliary elongation through Rho-actin dependent modulation of anterograde intraflagellar trafficking. This elongation is enhanced in the presence of interleukin-6 (IL-6) ( 24330727). IL-6/STAT3 promotes regeneration of airway ciliated cells from basal stem cells( 25136113)

Gene Description: inner mitochondrial membrane peptidase subunit 2 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:14598]
Functio l Summary from Literature: IMMP2L has localized in basal body,flagella.

Blocking the action of CD44 and IMPG1 in pluripotent stem cell derived reti l organoids affected the development of photoreceptors, their inner/outer segments and connecting cilia and disrupted IPM formation, with IMPG1 having an earlier and more significant impact (29777959).

Mutations in IMPG2 are associated with retinitis pigmentosa and vitelliform macular dystrophy (20673862). When probed with an antibody raised to its C-termi l intracellular domain, IMPG2 immunoreactivity was mostly found within the ellipsoid and myoid zones of the inner segment in normal photoreceptors. In normal photoreceptors, CEP290 allows entry of outer segment-bound proteins while blocking that of inner segment proteins such as STX3, STXBP1, S P25, and IMPG2. In Cep290fl/fl,Cre+ reti s, however, a significant amount of IMPG2 immunoreactivity was detected in outer segments in addition to inner segments (31694913).
Compensatory role in cilia development and regulation. Regulation of ciliary length (23805271).

Regulator of transition zone function. INPP5E may regulate Hedgehog sig ling via modulating the PI(4,5)P2- dependent recruitment of GPR161 to cilia. It is essential for maximal SMO accumulation at cilia after the Hh pathway (27998989). Controls ciliary growth factor, PI3K sig ling and stability (19668215). Mutations cause Joubert Syndrome and promotes premature destabilization of cilia (19668216).
INSR has localized in basal body ,transition zone.

Synonym.x: MAT89BB, FLJ10637, ASUN, NET48, SPATA30, C12ORF11
Functio l Summary from Literature: Depletion of INTS13 disrupts ciliogenesis in human cultured cells and causes dysregulation of a broad collection of ciliary genes. Mutations in INTS13 cause an autosomal recessive ciliopathy, which reveals key interactions between components of the Integrator complex ( 36229431).

Gene Description: inturned pla r cell polarity protein [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:29239]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Governs apical actin assembly and thus controls the orientation, but not assembly, of ciliary microtubules (16493421, 27158779). Cilia and pla r polarity effector, essential for IFT-A complex assembly during ciliogenesis, forming a molecular module with Fuzzy (FUZ) and WDPCP. INTU functions upstream of Gli2 activation and is required for Smo-mediated Hh pathway activation (28459465).

Mutations cause infantile nephronophthisis type 2. Role in left-right axis specification (12872123). Forms a stable complex with the cytoskeletal molecule tubulin and may be involved during early microtubule assembly in microtubule-organizing centers (15213257).
IPMK has localized in cilia.
IPO8 has localized in flagella.

Gene Description: IQ motif containing with AAA domain 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:26195]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Ciliary-motility related proteins, like HYDIN, IQCA1, and CATSPER2 accumulate towards the tip rather than show staining along the whole cilium, which might indicate for HYDIN and IQCA1 that they are not in fact implemented into the axoneme but might just transit the cilium.

Also known as NPHP5. Required for extension of an axoneme after docking of the basal body to the cell membrane. Absence leads to mislocalization of BBS2, BBS5 and destroys BBSome integrity (27328943). Interacts with CEP290 and is required for early cilia assembly, migration and/or anchoring of centrosomes to the cell cortex (23446637). NPHP5-binding to the BBSome is crucial for BBSome integrity and ciliary trafficking (25552655).
IQCD has localized in flagella.
Form a complex with EFCAB7. It anchors the EVC- EVC2 complex to positively regulate the Hh pathway (24582806)
Required for cilogenesis and spermiogenesis in mammals through a dy mic interaction with calmodulin in different intracellular calcium levels (24849454).
IQCH spatial distributed around the sperm axoneme, supporting its function within flagella.

Gene Description: IQ motif and ubiquitin domain containing [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:21995]
Functio l Summary from Literature: The IQUB deficiency caused significant down-regulation of the inner dynein arms of D H7 and D H12, highlighting their nearby location with RS1 (39849482).

IRS-1 is a docking protein that interacts with intracellular downstream sig lling molecules involved in IGF-1 receptor sig lling, interacts with Akt-1 at the transition neck region marked by Hsp90伪 (25359884).

ISX-like knockdown did not simply prevent the formation of the apical tuft cilia, but rather led to a loss of the apical tuft cell identity, i.e. the expression of the larva-specific ring neuron markers NVE8226 and NVE14902, as well as the expression of the upstream aboral regulator Six3/6, expanded into the spot domain ( 36000354).

Gene Description: itchy E3 ubiquitin protein ligase [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:13890]
Functio l Summary from Literature: ITCH plays a key regulatory role in cilium-based Hedgehog sig ling by controlling the degradation and trafficking of PTCH1, a cilia-localized receptor ( 25092867).

Integrin-β1 is required for the re l cystogenesis caused by ciliary defects and integrin-β1-controlled pathways as common drivers of the disease and as possible targets to interfere with the cystogenesis caused by ciliary defects ( 32308017).
ITGB6 localized to flagella (25613900)
ITLN1 has localized in flagella.
ITPR2 has localized in flagella.
IZUMO2 localized to mid piece, flagella (25613900).
IZUMO4 localized to connecting piece, flagella (25613900).

Ubiquitin ligase targeting 尾- catenin for proteasomal degradation. Component of the NPHP protein complex, interacting with NPHP4 which facilitates JADE-1 nuclear traslocation, leading to decreased canonical Wnt sig ling (22654112, 25100726).

Synonym.x: HJ1, JAGL1, CD339, AHD, AWS, AGS
Functio l Summary from Literature: In the lung, Apc deletion induced β-catenin accumulation and Jag1 expression in ciliated cells and by lateral induction, triggered Notch sig ling in adjacent Clara cells. In the bronchiolar epithelium, absence of Apc blocked the differentiation of a subpopulation of cells committed to the ciliogenesis program. In the human pulmo ry adenocarcinoma cells, Apc over-expression inhibited Jag1 expression and promoted motile ciliogenic gene expression program including Foxj1, revealing the potential mechanism( 23646120).
Regulator of multiciliated cell differentiation. It may function upstream of Foxj1 expression (29661797).

Gene Description: junctio l cadherin complex regulator [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:26288]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Required for ciliogenesis and proper differentiation of radial glia to functio l ependymal cells. Mutations cause congenital hydrocephalus and loss of JHY results in the lack of the ciliary microtubule central pair ( 29211732).
Katanin p60 displayed multiciliary localizations in mEPCs, abundant at the tip of short cilia (34608154).

Gene Description: katanin catalytic subunit A1 like 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:28361]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Role in neuro l migration, neuro l morphology and ependymal ciliary function (28373692). Regulates microtubule dy mics in Sertoli cells, a process that is essential for spermiogenesis and male fertility (22654668)

Gene Description: katanin catalytic subunit A1 like 2 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:25387]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Required for dy mic regulation of microtubules during axoneme formation and mainte nce, it may have the ability to remodel microtubules at different cellular locations. Role during the regulation of Wnt/pla r cell polarity (PCP)-dependent processes. Required for ciliogenesis, organogenesis and brain size control (30096282). Interacts with Nubp1 and Nubp2 AAA proteins, which act as negative regulators of ciliogenesis (26153462).

katanin p80 is not only involved in the formation of manchette and sperm head shape, but also in the correct formation of the flagellum as katanin p80 is also localized in the distal region of step III round spermatids (27717557).

Binds to microtubules and stabilise microtubule networks when overexpressed, it interacts with intraflagellar transport components and katanins associated with microtubules severing. Form a complex that regulates microtubule dy mics as well as ciliary functions. Negative regulator of ciliary length. Mutated in Joubert syndrome (27245168, 26714646).

Gene Description: potassium voltage-gated channel subfamily C member 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:6233]
Functio l Summary from Literature: KCNC family members (KCNC1, KCNC2, KCNC3, KCNC4) may be involved in ciliated neuro l compartments, based on strong homology and functio l parallels with C. elegans EGL-36, which localizes to the periciliary region of ciliated sensory neurons (33688626).

Gene Description: potassium voltage-gated channel subfamily C member 2 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:6234]
Functio l Summary from Literature: KCNC family members (KCNC1, KCNC2, KCNC3, KCNC4) may be involved in ciliated neuro l compartments, based on strong homology and functio l parallels with C. elegans EGL-36, which localizes to the periciliary region of ciliated sensory neurons (33688626).

Gene Description: potassium voltage-gated channel subfamily C member 3 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:6235]
Functio l Summary from Literature: KCNC family members (KCNC1, KCNC2, KCNC3, KCNC4) may be involved in ciliated neuro l compartments, based on strong homology and functio l parallels with C. elegans EGL-36, which localizes to the periciliary region of ciliated sensory neurons (33688626).

Gene Description: potassium voltage-gated channel subfamily C member 4 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:6236]
Functio l Summary from Literature: KCNC family members (KCNC1, KCNC2, KCNC3, KCNC4) may be involved in ciliated neuro l compartments, based on strong homology and functio l parallels with C. elegans EGL-36, which localizes to the periciliary region of ciliated sensory neurons (33688626).

Gene Description: potassium voltage-gated channel modifier subfamily F member 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:6246]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Ion channel gene that exhibits a significant negative effect on ciliogenesis but not on cell number. Potential new candidate in human ciliopathies (26546361).

Gene Description: potassium voltage-gated channel subfamily H member 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:6250]
Synonym.x: EAG, EAG1, H-EAG, HEAG, K(V)10.1, KV10.1
Functio l Summary from Literature: Also known as Kv10.1. Promotes ciliary disassembly and cell progression through localised changes of membrane potential at the ciliary base (28370099). Interacts with proteins involved in ciliary regulation, such as Rabaptin 5, cortactin, and HIF (27113750).

Gene Description: potassium inwardly rectifying channel subfamily J member 10 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:6256]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Ion channel gene that exhibits a significant negative effect on ciliogenesis but not on cell number (26546361).

Gene Description: potassium inwardly rectifying channel subfamily J member 13 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:6259]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Mutations are associated with the human reti l dystrophies LCA and Snowflake Vitreoreti l Degeneration (30009826).

Gene Description: potassium voltage-gated channel subfamily Q member 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:6294]
Synonym.x: JLNS1, KC 8, KC 9, KV7.1, KVLQT1, LQT, LQT1
Functio l Summary from Literature: Ion channel gene that exhibits a significant negative effect on ciliogenesis but not on cell number. Genetic variants are known to cause Long QT syndrome. KCNQ1 could be implicated in re l ciliopathies (26546361).
KCNRG has localized in basal body, transition zone.

Gene Description: potassium calcium-activated channel subfamily U member 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:18867]
Functio l Summary from Literature: SLO3 deficiency seriously impact acrosome formation, mitochondrial sheath assembly, and the function of K+ channels (34980136).

Gene Description: potassium channel tetramerization domain containing 10 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:23236]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Component of cullin-3鈥

Gene Description: potassium channel tetramerization domain containing 16 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:29244]
Functio l Summary from Literature: KCTD16 has localized in flagella.

Gene Description: potassium channel tetramerization domain containing 17 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:25705]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Substrate-adaptor for Cul3- RING E3 ligases (CRL3s) that modulates polyubiquitylation of trichoplein and e bles cells to assemble primary cilia by limiting Aurora-A activity. KCTD17 is required to initiate the axoneme extension during ciliogenesi (25270598).

Gene Description: potassium channel tetramerization domain containing 5 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:21423]
Functio l Summary from Literature: 18 genes identified whose loss reduced both basal Hedgehog sig ling and sig ling in response to SAG treatment (positive regulators), 20 genes whose loss activated the pathway without need for ligand (negative regulators), and two genes, Kctd5 and Ube2l3, that increased basal expression but reduced expression driven by SAG ( 34161574)

Negative regulator of ciliogenesis required for the controlled recruitment of IFT proteins into cilia through the modulation of actin dy mics. It binds to the actin cytoskeleton, creating a responsive actin gate involving ARP2/3 activity and regulating IFT within cilia and periciliary compartments. In the absence of KDM3A, access to cilia is unrestricted, so the assembly and growth of primary cilia is enhanced (28246120).
KIAA0319 knockout cause increased cilia length and accelerated cell migration (PMID: 35031635).

Required for ciliogenesis and sonic hedgehog/SHH sig ling. Role in primary cilia formation and microtubule organisation (19144723). Component of a CP110-containing protein complex required for centrosome and cilia function, Required for the centrosomal recruitment of RAB8A and for the targeting of centriole satellite proteins to centrosomes such as of PCM1. May play a role in early ciliogenesis in the disappearance of centriolar satellites that preceeds ciliary vesicle formation. Essential for centrosomal migration prior to ciliogenesis (24421332). Mutated in Joubert syndrome (26096313) and in skeletal ciliopathies (31816441, 32080096)

Mutated cause impaired ciliogenesis and result in Joubert Syndrome. Regulates centriole duplication positively by recruiting CDK2 to the centrosome, as well as WDR62 to the pericentriolar complex, which in turn recruits CEP63, interacts with CEP63, and regulate CEP63 level at the centrosome(28220259, 24613305). Also cause skeletal ciliopathies (31816441, 29138412).
KIAA1328 localized strongly and specifically to basal bodies, strongly supporting their participation in centrosomal and ciliary biology(28596423).
Mutations are associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa (30120214).
KIAA1671 has localized in cilia.

KIF11 has been demonstrated to have microtubule polymerase activity, as well as to control axon growth(26437877, 17846176). It has also been shown to mediate centrosome migration after mitosis and move Golgi material(9701554 , 23857769). An interphase pool of KIF11 localizes at the basal bodies of primary cilia and a reduction in KIF11 expression alters cilia dy mics(32811879).
The Mpkd2 locus-associated gene Kif12 encodes a primary cilium-associated protein (26295839).
Kinesin-3 members KIF13A, KIF1A, KIF1B also contain RPGRIP1N-C2 domains, like KIF13B , KIF13A heterologously expressed at the centrosome/cilium (28134340).

Essential for establishment of a CAV1 membrane microdomain at the transition zone and promotes Sonic hedgehog sig lling. Regulates transition zone membrane composition and ciliary SMO accumulation. Recruited to the ciliary base by NPHP4 (28134340).

Regulator of chromosome segregation, cytokinesis and midbody formation. Regulator of cilia formation, basal body biogenesis and Hedgehog (HH) sig ling. Depletion of KIF14 specifically leads to defects in ciliogenesis and basal body biogenesis (32348467). Mutations in humans and zebrafish cause ciliopathy-like kidney and microcephaly phenotypes (30388224, 24128419)

Interacts with importin-尾2 and Rab23 (26136363). Motor protein that may be needed to position the ciliary localization sig l CLS- containing protein at the ciliary base (20526328). Interacts with the IFT46鈥揑FT56 dimer in the IFT- B complex (28077622). Required for photoreceptor OS formation and protein targeting, implicated in ciliary membrane protein trafficking (18304522).
The loss of si:dkey-26i13.8 (KIF18B in human), showed a significant reduction in the length of motile cilia in the kidney tubules(25139857).

Also known as KIF19A. Controls ciliary length through its microtubule depolymerising activity. It also has a role in microtubule- based active motility toward the plus-end (27690357). Maintains the optimal length of motile cilia by depolymerising microtubules newly polymerised from axoneme at ciliary tips (23168168).
Cells expressing KIF1A or KIF1B, the fusion protein, kinesin-3 motors, and was detected at the ciliary base but not within the cilium itself in ciliated RPE1 cells (28134340).
Cells expressing KIF1A or KIF1B, the fusion protein, kinesin-3 motors, and was detected at the ciliary base but not within the cilium itself in ciliated RPE1 cells (28134340).
KIF1C has localized in flagella.
KIF20B has localized in basal body.
KIF23 localized to flagella (25613900)

Physiological substrate of Nek2. It prevents the outgrowth of cilia in proliferating cells. Ensure the disassembly of a ciliary axoneme in the later stages of the cell cycle (26290419). Interacts with CP110 and Cep97. Regulates ciliogenesis by dy mically controlling microtubule polymerisation (21620453). Controls the formation of primary cilia by restricting the nucleation of cilia at centrioles, it regulates CP110 localisation at mother centrioles (21663786).
KIF26A localized to flagella (25613900)
KIF26B localized at cilia

Essential for pla rian ciliogenesis (19933103). Kif27 expression is upregulated during mouse tracheal epithelial cells differentiation, consistent with their essential roles in motile ciliogenesis (19305393). Interacts with Fu and both may regulate central pair assembly, probably through the recruitment or activation of central pair proteins such as Spag16 and Pcdp1. It could also interact with basal body components or accessory structures in controlling cilia orientation (23907739).

Cell-specific kinesin-3 KLP-6(KIF28) acts as a modulator of both IFT dy mics and length in the cephalic male (CEM) cilia of Caenorhabditis elegans. KLP-6 moves independently of the kinesin-2 motors and acts to reduce the velocity of OSM-3 and IFT (21757353).

Promotes the primary cilium disassembly through its microtubule-depolymerising activity at the mother centriole, coupled with cell proliferation and blocking i ppropriate ciliogenesis during the cycling phase. Controls the cytoplasmic tubulin concentration to regulate primary cilia disassembly (25660017). Mutations cause primary microcephaly. Recruited by CEP170 (31197141).
Exogenous KIF2A, KIF2B, and KIF2C all localized to the basal bodys, and KIF2A and KIF2C, but not KIF2B, reduced ciliated cells to around 10%–20% compared with the control AcGFP1 (25660017).
Exogenous KIF2A, KIF2B, and KIF2C all localized to the basal bodys, and KIF2A and KIF2C, but not KIF2B, reduced ciliated cells to around 10%–20% compared with the control AcGFP1 (25660017).

Required for cilia assembly, function and organisation of subdistal appendiges of centrioles. Recruits p150Glued to the subdistal appendages of mother centrioles, critical for centrosomes to function as microtubule-organising centres and to recruit other subdistal appendage components such as Ninein and Cep170. Loss of Kif3a abrogates microtubule anchoring and ciliary basal foot formation (23386061).

Essential for ciliogenesis and the left鈥搑ight asymmetry through intraciliary transportation of materials for ciliogenesis of motile cilia that produces the nodal flow (9865700). Its phosphorylation inhibits IFT entry and flagellar lengthening restricting flagellar assembly (30057303).
KIF3C dimerizes with KIF3A, redundant with KIF3B. Contributes to ciliogenesis, driving the differentiation of outer segments at later stages of cilia formation (22308397, 23123805)
KIF4A has localized in flagella.
KIF4B has localized in flagella.
KIF5A localized to flagella (25613900)

Inhibitory role on cilia extension. Interacts with CCDC28B to regulate cilia length and the sub-cellular distribution of CCDC28B (29445114). Required for intraflagellar transport and the formation of primary cilia (31636894).
Mediator of ciliogenesis and normal cilia beating in ependmal cells in vertebrates. Mutations are reported to be associated with neurological abnormalities in humans (30475797).

Negative regulator of Hedgehog sig lling at cilia in mammals by controlling the activity of Gli and Sufu. Controls the localization of Hh sig ling complexes through its ability to regulate the dy mics of microtubule plus- ends. It inhibits microtubule growth to regulate the length of axonemal microtubules at the ciliary tip and control cilia structure (24981634, 24952464, 19592253). A conserved non- motile kinesin, Kif7 defines a "cilium-tip compartment" by localizing to the distal ends of axonemal microtubules, preferentially binds GTP- tubulin at microtubule ends over GDP-tubulin in the mature microtubule lattice (31031197)
Kif9 is necessary for ciliary motility and the proper distal localization of not only central pair proteins, but also radial spokes and dynein arms (35531639).
KIFAP3 has localized in basal body.

Required for ciliary membrane protein transport and serum starvation鈥搃nduced ciliogenesis. Role in the Golgi transport of membrane proteins from the Golgi complex to the primary cilium and in the recruitment of ciliogenesis regulators and mainte nce. Required for TTBK2 recruitment and CP110 removal from the distal end of the mother centriole to iniciate cilium assembly (29042452).

KIFC3 is a minus-end-directed kinesin-14, provides microtubule-based centrosome cohesion. KIFC3 forms a homotetramer that pulls the two centrosomes together via a specific microtubule network. At mitotic onset, KIFC3 activity becomes the main driving force of centrosome cohesion to prevent premature spindle formation after linker dissolution as it counteracts the increasing EG5-driven pushing forces (31481795).
Ciliary receptor which plays a role in reproductive function. Cilia are required for proper Kiss1r-mediated sig ling on GnRH neurons

Interacts with PLK1 in order to protect the centrosome from collapsing during spindle formation in mitosis. KIZ might have a critical role in this trafficking process. Mutations lead to autosomal- recessive Rod-Cone Dystrophy (24680887).
KLB localized to flagella (25613900)

CILK1 deficiency in a mouse model leads to polycystic kidney disease (PKD) with abnormal ciliary trafficking and that kinesin light chain鈥
KLF4 plays important roles for maintaining osteoblasts in an immature state by repressing basal activation of the Hedgehog sig ling ( 30193838).

KLHL4 has localized in cilia.
KMT5B has localized in cilia.

In mature auditory hair cells, KNCN was present at the cuticular plate, at the base of each stereocilium. KNCN was also expressed by the pillar cells and Deiters cells, that both contain prominent transcellular and apical bundles of microtubules . KNCN localized in microtubule-rich regions, where vesicles and cargos were actively transported (15855039). Deletion of Kncn does not affect kinocilium and stereocilia bundle morphogenesis and mechanotransduction in cochlear hair cells (30254566).
Inhibition of Kras effector pathways restored ciliogenesis in a mouse pancreatic cancer cell line, raising the possibility that ciliogenesis may be actively repressed by oncogenic Kras ( 19147554).

The loss of ciliated cells was compensated by the cells which contained the KRT5 basal cell marker but were not yet differentiated into ciliated cells ( 28004801).
LANCL1 localized at cilia

Newborn kidneys contain normal amounts of lymphoid enhancer-binding factor 1 (Lef1) and transcription factor 1 (Tcf1) protein, indicating normal function of the Wnt sig ling pathway, however, an increase in the protein Gli3 repressor reveals abnormal Hedgehog (Hh) sig ling evident in newborn kidneys ( 24946806).

Fgf4 was essential for the expression of lefty1, which is necessary for the asymmetric expression of southpaw and pitx2 in the lateral plate mesoderm, in the posterior notochord, and the expression of lefty2 and lefty1 in the left cardiac field ( 19481538).
Randomized expression of asymmetric genes, such as Nodal, Lefty2, and Pitx2, in the LPM of Pierce1-null embryos, indicating that PIERCE1 functions at the initial step of LR specification ( 27305836).

Treatment of N1 hypothalamic neuron cells with leptin stimulated cilia assembly via inhibition of the tumor suppressors PTEN and glycogen synthase ki se 3β (GSK3β). Induction of short cilia in the hypothalamus of adult mice increased food intake and decreased energy expenditure, leading to a positive energy balance. Mice with short hypothalamic cilia exhibited attenuated anorectic responses to leptin, insulin, and glucose, which indicates that leptin-induced cilia assembly is essential for sensing these satiety sig ls by hypothalamic neurons.( 24667636) .

BBS proteins are required for leptin receptor (LepR) sig ling in the hypothalamus. BBS1 protein physically interacts with the LepR and that loss of BBS proteins perturbs LepR trafficking (19150989). Immunocytochemistry for AC3 or the basal body marker 纬-tubulin in LEPR-EGFP鈥揺xpressing cells demonstrated that LEPR-EGFP localized to the 纬-tubulin鈥搒tained basal body (Figure 3A), which indicates that the leptin sig ling machinery is a tomically linked to cilia鈥揵asal body complexes(24667636) .

Immunocytochemistry for AC3 or the basal body marker γ-tubulin in LEPR-EGFP–expressing cells demonstrated that LEPR-EGFP localized to the γ-tubulin–stained basal body , which indicates that the leptin sig ling machinery is a tomically linked to cilia–basal body complexes (24667636).
Absence of galectin-3 influences the stabilization of centrosomes and primary cilia, with effects on epithelial cell organization(19923323).

Although higher levels of LGALS3BP expression lead to the dispersion of PCM, depletion results in the generation of multiple centriolar structures. The PCM hypertrophy- and accumulation of centriolar structure-phenotypes correlate directly with centrosome morphology aberrations in cancer cells and patient tissues with deregulated levels of LGALS3BP(23443559).

Mucociliary Wnt sig ling is essential for ciliogenesis and it engages Lrp6 co-receptors that localize to cilia via a VxP ciliary targeting sequence(36878953).

Radial spoke protein with function in ciliary motility and motile cilia formation. Mutations in Lrrc23 result in ciliary motility defects specifically in the cilia of the otic vesicle (29475374).

Mutated in Joubert syndrome. Localized along the ciliary shaft in controls but only at ciliary base in LRRC34-/- patient cells, which displayed reduced ciliogenesis potential and muted response of SHH sig ling to SAG compared with controls (32055034)

Recruits the keratin-binding protein FBF1. Promotes cilia biogenesis in CP110- uncapped centrioles by organising centriolar satellites. It is required for centrosome cohesion at the proximal end of centrioles. Establishes the transition zone, recruitment of Rab8 and satellites to centrosomes, and promotes the docking of Rab8 GTPase-positive vesicles to the mother centriole (30131441).

Leucine-rich repeat containing 46 (LRRC46) is one of the the multiple morphological abnormalities of the flagella (MMAF)-related protein and specifically expressed in the testes of adult mice, and show that LRRC46 is essential for sperm flagellum biogenesis. The mutation of Lrrc6, an important paralog of Lrrc46, causes 10.6% primary ciliary dyskinesia by the absence of dynein arm components (23527195 , 23122589). Knockout of Lrrc46 in mice resulted in typical MMAF phenotypes, including sperm with short, coiled, and irregular flagella(35955660).

C11ORF49 and LRRC49, which we have re- med centriolar satellite-associated tubulin polyglutamylation proteins, CSTPP1 and CSTPP2, respectively, are novel cytoplasmic regulators of both cilium disassembly and nuclear morphology (34782749).
Slo3 and LRRC52 proteins localized  in human sperm (24670955).

Interacts with the intraflagellar transport (IFT) protein IFT88. Required for the transport and addition of dynein arms to the distal end of the flagellum during cilia assembly. Mutations result in a disease entity within the group of mucociliary clearance disorders and loss of ciliary motility (30388400).

Localizes to both actin filaments and the centrosome/basal body. Is an actin-stabilizing protein that regulates actin dy mics, at least in part, by mobilizing ARP2 to the centrosomes. Coordi tes the interactions between the BBSome and the IFT particle to regulate the removal of Ptch1 and Smo from cilia (25446516). Depletion leads to a Bardet-Biedl syndrome phenotype (22510444).

Functio l Summary from Literature: Role in coordi tion of actin and microtubules, critical in ciliogenesis, mainte nce and regulation of apicobasal polarity. In ciliated cells, MC4R localized to primary cilia (29311635).

Macrophage migration inhibitory factor (MIF) is a structure protein of basal bodies, which forms a ring-like structure at proximal end of centrioles to regulate cilia assembly and elongation through defined ciliary proteins, including CP110, TTBK2, CEP290, and IFT related proteins, The phosphatidylinositol-5-phosphate 4-ki se type 2 alpha (PIP4K2a) is an upstream regulator of MIF, which interacts and phosphorylates MIF at S91 to increase the interaction of MIF with 14-3-3味, resulting in MIF nuclear translocation. Myo1c neck region binds to available receptors at stereociliary tips, the site of transduction, in the pericuticular necklace, a vesicle-rich region encircling the cuticular plate, in the kinocilium, a cilium located at the tall edge of the hair bundle, and also within the hair-cell soma. Myo1c binding is modulated by CaM, which implicated the CaM-binding IQ domains in receptor interactions (11923413). The second CaM-binding IQ domain as a region of Myo1c that mediates CaM-sensitive binding to stereociliary tips and to PIP2 immobilized on a solid support. Myo1c and Cdh23 interact at the tips of hair-cell stereocilia and that this interaction is modulated by CaM (17050716).

Myo1D controls the orientation of LRO cilia and interacts functio lly with the pla r cell polarity (PCP) pathway component VanGogh-like2 (Vangl2), to shape a productive LRO flow. Our findings identify Myo1D as an evolutio rily conserved regulator of animal LR asymmetry, and show that functio l interactions between Myo1D and PCP are central to the establishment of animal LR asymmetry ( 29769531).
Mediates movement along actin filaments in the cell (26098909). Prevents photoreceptor loss of function caused by Myo3A defects, as it could provide functio l redundancy for Myo3A (19332056 ).

Knockout results in reduction in ciliation, suggesting MYO5A is required for ciliogenesis. It might link microtubule cargo from Golgi or cilium (28710093). Interacts with the cilia- centrosomal protein RPGRIP1L (28266547).

NEK10 is a ciliated-cell specific ki se that regulates the motile ciliary proteome to promote ciliary length, and its deficiency produces short motile cilia . Required for effective airway mucociliary clearance (31959991). Phosphorylates the centrosomal linker proteins C-  p1, Cep68 and Rootletin to promote centriole separation, and is involved in the development of left-right asymmetry by regulating balancing ciliogenesis and resorption (26493400). Phosphorylates Kif24, a depolymerising kinesin (26290419). Influences centrosome-anchored microtubules organisation and promotes cilium disassembly at the onset of mitosis (22613497). NEK2 removes distal appendage components from the mother centriole, preventing cilia mainte nce during mitosis (32211891).

Biallelic loss of function NEK3 mutations were found in 2 families with abnormal cardiac left-right patterning. NEK3 depeletion was associated with deacetylation of 伪-tubulin and downregulation of NUP205, NUP188, and NUP155 and defective ciliary ultrastructure (33230144)
Interacts with RPGRIP1 and RPGRIP1L to regulate cilium integrity and/or assembly. It associates with ciliary rootlets to regulate cilia stability

Nek7 deficiency does not affect centrosome duplication but leads to disturbed frequency of primary cilia ( 20473324).

Mutations cause nephronophthisis (NPHP9), it can be transported into cilia by Inv (20169535). Controls or modulates the ciliary localization of PC1 and PC2, as well as ciliary length (18235101). It is speculated that Nek8 activity may be required to initiate ciliogenesis, and degradation may be required to prevent it (22106379). Component of the PC2 channel complex required to mediate nodal calcium flux, indispensable for the establishment of left-right asymmetry (23274954).

NEK9 interacts with MYH9 (also known as myosin IIA), which has been implicated in inhibiting ciliogenesis through stabilization of the actin network. MYH9 accumulates in NEK9 LIR mutant cells and mice, and depletion of MYH9 restores ciliogenesis in NEK9 LIR mutant cells ( 34078910).

Neurofibromin, the product of the Neurofibromatosis-1 gene (NF1), a major Ras GTPase activating protein (RasGAP) in neural cells, controls also the critical function of chromosome congression in astrocytic cellular contexts. NLS-neurofibromin knockdown led to increased density of cytosolic MTs but loss of MT intersections, a stral spindles featuring large hollows and abnormal chromosome positioning, and fi lly abnormal chromosome segregation and increased micronuclei frequency.
