Gene Description: RAB23, member RAS oncogene family [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:14263]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Negative regulator of the Hedgehog sig ling pathway, required for retrograde transport away from primary cilia (17646400). It mediates the ciliary recycle of Smo (20375059). Facilitates binding of cytiplasmatic Kif17 with ciliary import carrier importin 尾2, essential for its targeting to the primary cilium (26136363).

Gene Description: RAB28, member RAS oncogene family [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:9768]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Associated with autosomal recessive cone-rod dystrophy. IFT-associated cargo with BBSome-dependent cell autonomous and non- autonomous functions at the ciliary base, maintaining the structural and functio l integrity of cilia (27930654). Ciliary Rab28 and the BBSome negatively regulate extracellular vesicle shedding (32101165)

Gene Description: RAB29, member RAS oncogene family [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:9789]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Colocalizes and interacts with Rab8, Rab11 and IFT20. Participates in ciliogenesis by controlling cilium growth, by promoting the transport of endosome-associated ciliary cargo to the base of the cilium. Required for Smo trafficking to the ciliary membrane.

Gene Description: RAB34, member RAS oncogene family [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:16519]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Rab34 regulates the early steps in serum starvation- induced ciliogenesis in hTERT-RPE1 cells, through a unique N-termi l region, by regulating the ciliary vesicle fusion step and/or the subsequent expansion. Required for ciliogenesis in only certain cell types (32669361). Rab34 is required for the successive fusion of small preciliary vesicles in order to generate ciliary vesicles, it is also required for the migration of the mother centriole from perinuclear region to cell membrane. Required for an early step of ciliary vesicle formation and Hh sig ling in vivo. Mutation results in significant decrease of ciliogenesis in both cultured cells and mice (30301781). Potential transcriptio l target of Gli transcription factors (17442700).

Also known as Rabin8. GTP loading by Rabin8 promotes Rab8 association with post- Golgi vesicles and targets them to polarised areas of the plasma membrane. BBS1 subunit of the BBSome associates with the C terminus of Rabin8 at the basal body. Activates Rab8 by loading with GTP, which is necessary for Rab8 to enter the primary cilium, promoting ciliogenesis and apical membrane formation (17574030). Phosphorylation of Rabin8 might modulate its interactions with ASAP1 and Rab11a. It binds to the catalytically active ASAP1 in complex with Rab11a and FIP3 (25673879). Interacts with Chibby to promote recruitment of Rab8 and efficient assembly of ciliary vesicles. Interaction with Rab11 stimulates its GEF activity (25313408) and is required for Rabin8 preciliary membrane trafficking to the centrosome and for ciliogenesis (21273506).

Gene Description: RAB6A, member RAS oncogene family [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:9786]
Functio l Summary from Literature: RAB6A has localized in basal body.

Gene Description: RAB6B, member RAS oncogene family [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:14902]
Functio l Summary from Literature: RAB6B has localized in basal body.

Gene Description: RAB6C, member RAS oncogene family [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:16525]
Functio l Summary from Literature: RAB6C has localized in basal body, transition zone.

Gene Description: RAB6D, member RAS oncogene family [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:30272]
Functio l Summary from Literature: RAB6D has localized in basal body, transition zone.

Gene Description: RAB7A, member RAS oncogene family [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:9788]
Functio l Summary from Literature: The small GTPase RAB7A lozalized in the transition zone

Gene Description: RAB8A, member RAS oncogene family [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:7007]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Rab8 targets vesicles to the cilium and promotes ciliary membrane elongation. It is activated by Rabin8 (17574030, 22433857). I ctivating Rab8 (GDP- bound state) blocks ciliogenesis and induces BBS phenotypes in zebrafish (17574030). Rab8a, Rab8b and Rab10 work synergistically for ciliogenesis (24213529). Rab8a specifically interacts with cenexin/ODF2, a basal body and microtubule binding protein required for cilium biogenesis (17646400). Regulates the trafficking of rhodopsin in photoreceptors. Interacts with RPGR which regulates its activity and localisation. Involved in polarised trafficking of vesicles from the trans-Golgi network (20631154). Involved in serum-starvation-induced ciliogenesis (32669361)

Gene Description: rabaptin, RAB GTPase binding effector protein 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:17677]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Rabep1/GGA1/Arl3-dependent ciliary targeting mechanism, whereby Rabep1 couples the polycystin complex to a GGA1/Arl3-based ciliary trafficking module at the TGN ( 25405894).

Gene Description: rabaptin, RAB GTPase binding effector protein 2 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:24817]
Functio l Summary from Literature: RABEP2 localization at the centrosome is regulated by SDCCAG8. As a component of cilium, it may be a component of the intraciliary transport mechanism. siR  mediated knockdown in hTERT-RPE1 cells abolished cilia formation, indicating a critical role in ciliogenesis (27224062).

Gene Description: RAB, member of RAS oncogene family like 2A [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:9799]
Functio l Summary from Literature: RABL2 paralog. Functio lly redundant with RABL2B as they can rescue ciliogenesis when both genes have been knocked out (28625565). Associates with ciliary GPCR in mammalian primary cilia and regulates theirs localisation (30578315). Two variants in RABL2A were identified as cause of male infertility and ciliopathy (33075816). RABL2 might play a role in trafficking of ciliary proteins as well as ciliogenesis. RABL2A/B knock out lead to decrease in number of primary cilia in RPE1 cells (30578315).

Gene Description: RAB, member of RAS oncogene family like 2B [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:9800]
Functio l Summary from Literature: RABL2 paralog. Functio lly redundant with RABL2A as they can rescue ciliogenesis when both genes have been knocked out (28625565). Associates with ciliary GPCR in mammalian primary cilia and regulates theirs localisation (30578315). It is recruited by CEP19 to the ciliary base where it mediates release of IFT-B from pre-docked complexes to initiate IFT ciliary entry, CEP19-RABL2B complex is then a critical regulator that initiates intraflagellar transport at the ciliary base (28625565). Variant in RABL2B gene could be a risk factor in Iranian infertile men with oligoasthenoteratozoospermia (28138870).

Gene Description: RAB, member of RAS oncogene family like 3 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:18072]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Atypical small GTPase RAB-like 3 (RABL3) plays an important role, in cooperation with RAB11, in CV formation during early ciliogenesis(36052645).

Gene Description: RAB, member RAS oncogene family like 6 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:24703]
Synonym.x: BA216L13.9, C9ORF86, PP8875, RBEL1, PARF, FLJ13045, FLJ10101
Functio l Summary from Literature: RABL6 has localized in cilia.

In both wild type and Arhgap35D34/D34 proximal tubules Rac1 and RhoA are enriched at the basal bodies to similar degrees. p190A plays a role at the docked basal body to downregulate active RhoA (and possibly Rac1) to allow the localized actin cytoskeleton rearrangement required for cilia elongation (26859289).

Loss of RACGAP1, mother centrioles were specified correctly prior to ciliogenesis and the cilia appeared normal, Racgap1 knockdown results in cells with multiple cilia due to cytokinesis failure ( 37771269).

Gene Description: receptor for activated C ki se 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:4399]
Functio l Summary from Literature: RACK1 regulates centriole duplication by controlling the centrosomal localization of BRCA1 in mammary tissue-derived cells and that this is dependent on the BRCA1鈥揜ACK1 interaction(30617304).

Gene Description: Ral GTPase activating protein catalytic subunit alpha 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:17770]
Synonym.x: GRIPE, DKFZP667F074, RALGAPALPHA1, TULIP1, GARNL1, KIAA0884
Functio l Summary from Literature: RALGAPA1 has localized in flagella.

Gene Description: RAN, member RAS oncogene family [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:9846]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Ran GTP regulates ciliary protein transport and ciliogenesis (21998203). RanGTP gradient regulates trafficking and entry of kinesin motor KIF17 into cilium. It has been proposed that Ran plays a role in regulating cellular compartmentalisation by controlling the shuttling of cytoplasmic proteins into ciliary compartments (20526328). Interacts with Importin 尾2, which interacts directly with cargoes, releasing them upon binding Ran GTP and regulating localisation of RP2 (21285245).

Negative regulator of Ran GTP, as it stimulates Ran GTP to GDP conversion. RanBP1 Knockdown results in an increased concentration of Ran GTP at basal bodies, leading to ciliogenesis. Overexpression antagonizes primary cilia formation.
RANGAP1 has localized in basal body,flagella.
GARNL4 localized to centrosome (21399614).

Gene Description: Rap guanine nucleotide exchange factor 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:4568]
Functio l Summary from Literature: RAPGEF1 regulates centrosome duplication and maintains ciliary homeostasis, properties that could be important for its role in embryonic development(32371504).

Gene Description: Rap guanine nucleotide exchange factor 3 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:16629]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Microtubule-associated proteins (MAPs) regulate cAMP sig lling through exchange protein directly activated by cAMP (EPAC) and P2Y12 and components of the EPAC 1 - 2 (one of the AKAP sig ling complex) are expressed in cholangiocyte cilia(18687752).

Gene Description: Rap guanine nucleotide exchange factor 4 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:16626]
Functio l Summary from Literature: EPAC is expressed in cholangiocyte cilia (18687752)., Microtubule-associated proteins (MAPs) regulate cAMP sig lling through exchange protein directly activated by cAMP (EPAC) and P2Y12 and components of the EPAC 1 - 2 (one of the AKAP sig ling complex) are expressed in cholangiocyte cilia(18687752).

Gene Description: receptor associated protein of the sy pse [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:9863]
Functio l Summary from Literature: rapsyn and NUP88 localisation at basal bodys and cilia (33168876).

Synonym.x: P120GAP, P120, RASA, P120RASGAP, GAP, CM-AVM
Functio l Summary from Literature: RASA1 has localized in basal body.
RBM5 has localized in basal body,flagella.

Negative regulator of calcineurin and modulates Ca2+ dependent sig lling. Required to maintain normal cilia length. Depletion in WT RPE-1 cells results in shorter cilia, whilst in giantin KO cells induces longer cilia (29643119).

Gene Description: RCC1 and BTB domain containing protein 2 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:1914]
Functio l Summary from Literature: RC/BTB2 is a necessary component of the process of formation of primary cilia in somatic cells, perhaps through the transportation of cargos from Golgi bodies to centrosomes for cilia assembling(25762510).

Also known as CAPZIP. Ortholog duboraya (dub), has been reported to be essential for actin organization in the cells lining Kupffer's vesicle, regulates ciliogenesis in a phosphorylation-dependent manner as well as left-right patterning in zebrafish ( 17013396). Phosphorylated by ERK7. Ciliogenesis regulations through CapZIP, requires Dvl binding to both ERK7 and CapZIP ( 25823377).
RCVRN has localized in flagella.

Involved in regulation of ALMS1 in vivo, by binding its promoter (20381594). Coordi tes multiple, distinct gene expression programs in MCCs, regulating genes encoding axonemal dynein subunits, components of the transition zone anb BBSome, centriolar genes and pla r cell polarity (PCP) effector fritz/wdpcp. It also regulates the extracellular matrix component dag1, which is a regulator of MCC insertion (24424412). Critical regulator of vertebrate ciliogenesis. Knockdown results in phenotypes associated with defective cilia, such as disruption of neural tube closure and left鈥搑ight asymmetry (22227339).

Transcription factor regulating expression of ciliary assembly (like Dync2li1, Foxj1 and Bbs4) and axonemal dyneins involved in ciliary motility (D hc11, D hc9 and D hc5), by binding directly to the promoters of their genes. Regulates the orthologs of genes involved inhuman PCD. It may also cooperate with FOXJ1 to regulate the expression of cilia genes ( 19671664). Regulates the expression of D2lic in mouse, a gene implicated in intraflagellar transport, a proces required for the assembly and mainte nce of cilia. RFX3 is essential for the differentiation of nodal monocilia and for LR patterning ( 15121860). Together with FOXJ1, plays a role in modulating differentiation in multiciliated cells ( 23822649).

Modulates Shh sig ling and and Gli3 processing by regio l control of ciliogenesis and function of primary cilia. Rfx4 nuclear translocation and/or transcriptio l activity, may be regulated by phosphorylation. Required for ciliogenesis in the neural tube ( 19887680). It appears to regulate different genes than RFX3, as Rfx4 KO embryos exhibite different phenotypes from those with Rfx3 and Foxj1 mutations ( 29298325). RFX4 expression is controlled positively by RFX7 or negatively by Foxj1 during neural tube closure ( 24530844).
Highly expressed in Brain. RFX7 controls positively the formation of cilia by regulating the expression of RFX4 gene. Involved in complete neural tube closure (24530844).

Gene Description: regulator of G protein sig ling 5 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:10001]
Functio l Summary from Literature: RGS5 is an endogenous regulator of Hh-mediated sig ling and that RGS proteins are potential targets for novel therapeutics in Hh-mediated diseases(PMID: 23637832).

Gene Description: regulator of G protein sig ling 8 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:16810]
Functio l Summary from Literature: MCHR1-positive primary cilia are significantly elongated in the CA1 of RGS8tg, compared with that in wild mice. Depression-like behavior in RGS8tg might result through RGS8-ciliary MCHR1 interaction in the CA1 region ( 29758252).

Gene Description: regulator of G protein sig ling 9 binding protein [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:30304]
Functio l Summary from Literature: RGS9BP has localized in flagella.

Cilia-specific GPCR essential for vision. Multiple roles in trafficking, interacts with Arf4, TcTex-1 and SARA (23966685). Mutations cause protein misfolding and retention in the endoplasmic reticulum, leading to cellular stress and cell death. Mutations are associated with retinitis pigmentosa (32343782).

Gene Description: ras homolog family member A [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:667]
Functio l Summary from Literature: p190A specifically at the basal body to promote ciliogenesis through a local dampening of Rho GTPase-dependent F-actin polymerization. In both wild type and Arhgap35D34/D34 proximal tubules Rac1 and RhoA are enriched at the basal bodies to similar degrees (26859289).

Gene Description: ras homolog family member U [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:17794]
Synonym.x: FLJ10616, WRCH-1, ARHU, CDC42L1, FJ646B12.2, WRCH1, HG28K, DJ646B12.2
Functio l Summary from Literature: RHOU has localized in primary cilia.

RIBC1 (RIB43A domain with coiled-coils 1) and RIBC2 (RIB43A domain with coiled-coils 2) are homolog proteins of RIB43a which is localized to microtubules in the cilia and flagella of unicellular organisms (40265983).

RIBC1 (RIB43A domain with coiled-coils 1) and RIBC2 (RIB43A domain with coiled-coils 2) are homolog proteins of RIB43a which is localized to microtubules in the cilia and flagella of unicellular organisms (40265983).

Gene Description: Rab interacting lysosomal protein like 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:26814]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Rab effector-related protein, regulates protein concentration by removal of membrane proteins from the cilium. Depletion results in accumulation of sig ling proteins in the ciliary membrane, including Smo. Interacts with activated Rab34, Rab36, Rab12 and Rab40B (23264467). Interacts with the LRRK2- phosphorylated forms of Rab8A and Rab10 (29125462). Enhances pRab10 clustering on pericentriolar membranes to suppress ciliogenesis (30398148).

Gene Description: Rab interacting lysosomal protein like 2 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:28787]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Rab effector-related protein that exhibist dy mic localisation, regulates protein concentration by removal of membrane proteins from the cilium.. Depletion results in accumulation of sig ling proteins in the ciliary membrane, including Smo. Interacts with activated Rab34 and Rab36 (23264467). Binds to phosphorylated Rab8A, Rab10, and Rab12. As it binds Rab8a much stronger than RILPL1, RILPL2 might be a key effector specific for pRab8A (29125462).

Gene Description: RHO family interacting cell polarization regulator 2 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:13872]
Synonym.x: C6ORF32, DIFF48, FAM65B, KIAA0386, MYO P
Functio l Summary from Literature: Mutations cause deafness. Interacts with Myh9, which is related to deafness. Regulates the abundance and post translatio l modifications of proteins highly expressed within the kinocilium , which suggestes a role in hair bundle morphogenesis (30280293).
UBE2E1 underwent auto-ubiquiti tion and that ubiquiti tion was enhanced but not dependent on RNF34 (35170427).
RNPEP has localized in flagella.

Gene Description: Ro60, Y R  binding protein [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:11313]
Functio l Summary from Literature: RO60 has localized in ciliary tip, primary cilia.
ROBO1 has localized in primary cilia.

Gene Description: reti l outer segment membrane protein 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:10254]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Outer segment protein. Its localisation depends on AHI1 (20592197). Non- covalently linked PRPH2/ROM1 complex can initiate OS formation, whilst covalent oligomerisation is required for proper OS maturation (32716032, 29961824). Creates and maintains the rim region of rod discs and cone lamellae and help to regulate disc size and alignment (29961824). Homozygous frameshift mutation has been recently associated with pattern dystrophy (30630813).
ROPN1B has localized in flagella.

Gene Description: rhophilin associated tail protein 1 like [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:24060]
Synonym.x: ASP, FLJ25776, LINC01513, RP11-1C1.7, RSPH11, TCONS_00009352
Functio l Summary from Literature: Functions as a key molecule in the mainte nce of basal ciliary beat frequency. Its role in ciliary motility coulb be played via regulation of axonemal sig ling (22021175)

Nonsense mutation associated with retinitis pigmentosa (10401003). Microtubule- associated protein containing the doublecortin (DCX) domain. Disruption of Rp1 in mice causes misorientation of outer segment discs, suggesting a role in outer segment organisation. Stimulates microtubule polymerization and stabilise existing microtubules in vitro and in vivo, therefore, it controls the length and stability of the photoreceptor axoneme (15269252). Due to Rp1 localisation, it may be involved in the formation of outer segments (11773008). Plays synergistic role with Rp1L1 in affecting photosensitivity and OS morphogenesis of rod photoreceptors (19657028).

Shares similar DCX tandem repeats and a 34 aa domain (RP1D) with Rp1. Plays essential and synergistic roles with Rp1 in affecting photosensitivity and OS morphogenesis of rod photoreceptors. Mutations in RP1L1 could underlie retinopathy or modify RP1 disease expression in humans (19657028). Mutations in RP1L1 have been associated with occult macular dystrophy and RP (20826268)

Gene Description: RP2 activator of ARL3 GTPase [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:10274]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Interacts with Arl3 and mediates the localization of GFP-Kif17 to the cilia tip and interacts with the regulator of Hedgehog (Hh) sig ling Kif7. This suggests RP2 is implicated primary cilia protein trafficking via the regulation of kinesin motor proteins at the ciliary tip (28444310). Loss of RP2 leads to fragmentation of the Golgi network and dispersal of vesicles cycling cargo from the Golgi complex to the cilium, including IFT20. It indicates a role for RP2 in regulating vesicle traffic and docking from the Golgi to the base of the cilium (20106869). Interacts with polycystin 2 and regulates its trafficking within the cilium (20729296). RP2 entry to the ciliary compartiment is regulated by Importin 尾2 (21285245). Mutations are associated with with X- linked retinitis pigmentosa (9697692).

Gene Description: R  polymerase II associated protein 2 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:25791]
Functio l Summary from Literature: RPAP2 has localized in cilia.

Gene Description: R  polymerase II associated protein 3 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:26151]
Functio l Summary from Literature: RPAP3 has localized in basal body.

Role in regulation of  scent disc formation in photoreceptor cilium, by regulating actin-mediated membrane extension. Absence of RPGR impaired ciliogenesis and cell attachment (21933838). Mutations cause type 3 retinis pigmentosa (8673101). RPGR is suggested to regulate cilia function and facilitate the trafficking of proteins along the photoreceptor cilium. Interacts withciliary proteins, such as RPGRIP1, IQCB1, CEP290 and RPGRIP1L, as well as Rab8a (20631154).

Known ciliopathy gene CORD13. Mutations are known causes of RP and Leber congenital amaurosis. Potential structural component of the ciliary axoneme, which anchors RPGR within the cilium (11104772, 15772089). Required for disk morphogenesis and RPGR retention in the connecting cilium (12651948). Essential for rod OS formation, probably by regulating the transport of proteins from the IS to the OS (19679561). Required for ciliary targeting of NPHP4 and SDCCAG8, Rab8 localisation in photoreceptors and is involved in rhodopsin ciliary vesicle transport in zebrafish (29203866).

Synonym.x: CORS3, FTM, JBTS7, KIAA1005, MKS5, NPHP8, PPP1R134
Functio l Summary from Literature: Mutations cause Joubert (17558407) and Meckel syndrome (17558409). It functions as cilium-specific scaffold that recruits a Nek4 sig ling network to regulate cilium assembly and stability. Interacts with RPGR (21685204). Loss of RPGRIP1L in human primary cell cultures and mice increases ciliary axonemal length (30728336). Interacts with MKS and NPHP proteins, and could potentially act as part of the gate for cytoplasmic proteins (30237221). Interacts with Psmd2, regulating the activity of the ciliary proteasome at the transition zone to control ciliary sig ling. This proteosomal function could be involved in the control of ciliary length (26150391). Rpgrip1l positively controls dishevelled levels. In the mouse and zebrafish, Rpgrip1l is required for positioning the basal body along the pla r polarity axis, morphants display pla r cell polarity defects (22927466).
Rpl10a, Rpl11, and Rps3 were detected as puncta in ependymal multicilia (34848703)
Rpl10a, Rpl11, and Rps3 were detected as puncta in ependymal multicilia (34848703)
Multiple components of translation machinery are present in the cilia of RG, including ribosome components, RPS23 and RPL19, and translation factors, EIF3C, EEF2 and EEF1G.
Certain ribosome components, RPL23A, specifically localize to the base of cilia in RG.
Multiple components of translation machinery are present in the cilia of RG, including ribosome components, RPS23 and RPL19, and translation factors, EIF3C, EEF2 and EEF1G.
Rpl10a, Rpl11, and Rps3 were detected as puncta in ependymal multicilia (34848703)

Gene Description: ribosomal protein S6 ki se A1 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:10430]
Functio l Summary from Literature: p90RSK (RPS6KA1-p90) is activated downstream of the MEK1/2鈥揈RK1/2 pathway after PDGFR伪伪 sig ling in the primary cilium, which results in activation of p90RSK at the ciliary base (23264740).

Gene Description: RRAD, Ras related glycolysis inhibitor and calcium channel regulator [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:10446]
Functio l Summary from Literature: RRAD has localized in basal body,flagella.

Gene Description: ribonucleotide reductase catalytic subunit M1 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:10451]
Functio l Summary from Literature: RRM1 has localized in basal body, transition zone.

Gene Description: ribosomal R  processing 7 homolog A [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:24286]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Localizes to centrosomes, cilia and nucleoli. Highly expressed in neural stem cells in developing human forebrain, and a missense mutation is associated with microcephaly. Targeted mutation of Rrp7a leads to defects in neurogenesis and proliferation in a mouse stem cell model and in zebrafish causes reduced brain size, impaired neurogenesis and cell proliferation, and defective ribosomal R  processing. Patient-derived fibroblasts display defects in ribosomal R  processing, primary cilia resorption, and cell cycle progression (33199730)
The senescence-regulator RSL1D1 localized at cilia

Mutations have been shown to cause PCD (25473808, 24568568). Integral component of the ciliary axoneme expressed during ciliated cell differentiation (24568568). Mainly expressed in tissues with motile cilia or flagella, absence of RSPH1 leads toabnormal axonemal configuration with central- complex defects, suggesting a role for RSPH1 in proper building of central-complexes and radial spokes (23993197).

Gene Description: radial spoke head 10 homolog B [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:27362]
Functio l Summary from Literature: RSPH10B has localized in cilia.

Gene Description: radial spoke head 10 homolog B2 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:34385]
Functio l Summary from Literature: RSPH10B2 has localized in cilia.

Protein ki se A-anchoring protein that scaffolds the cAMP-dependent protein ki se holoenzyme (19684019). Mutations are associated with PCD, with CC/RS defects like abnormal axoneme configuration and absence of RS. Required for proper building of RSs and the CC in humans (26073779). Mutations in RSPH3 in Chlamydomo s reinhardtii lead to paralyzed flagella due to loss of the entire radial spoke structure (29475374).

Component of spoke heads. Plays a central role in the assembly of all the three- types of RS. Contributes to the generation of the pla r beating of motile cilia by building the distal architecture of radial spokes, regulating the motion pattern of the mouse motile cilia. Mutations lead to most severe phenotype of PCD with central complex defects and near absence of radial spokes (26073779, 25789548) Essential for the triplet radial spoke head assembly of the mouse motile cilia (32203505).

Gene Description: radial spoke head 6 homolog A [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:14241]
Functio l Summary from Literature: RSPH6A is required for sperm flagellar assembly and male fertility in mice. Interacts with RSPH1, RSPH4A, RSPH9 and RSPH10B, where nteraction of RSPH6A and RSPH9 is important to incorporate RSPH9 into the flagella. Absence of RSPH6A leads to immotile spermatozoa in mice (30185526). Expressed exclusively in testicular germ cells during meiosis. Rsph6a is phosphorylated by PKA during sperm capacitation (30239614).

Component of the axonemal radial spoke head. Mutations cause PCD with defects of the central microtubular pair, where altered function of the radial spoke heads causes 9+2 cilia motility to resemble the rotary 9+0 cilia movement (19200523). Essential for ciliary structure and motility in mouse ependymal cilia, deletion causes hydrocephalus. Dysfunction of RSPH9 changes the motion pattern of motile cilia. (32709945). Required for RS head assembly and centrail pair mainte nce in mammalian ependimal cilia (30383886).

Regulates early embryonic axial rotation, anteroposterior and dorsoventral patterning in mice and is required for mainte nce of a normal ciliary structure (22939636). Required for assembly of full-length centrioles through its STIL- RTTN interaction, it also serves as an upstream effector of CEP295 (28811500). Centrosomal protein possibly involved in centriolar elongation and ciliogenesis. Mutations cause polymicrogyria (30879067) and missense or splicing variants have been found in patients with microcephaly (29967526).
RUNDC3B has localized in cilia.
Expression level of hematopoietic stem and progenitor cell marker, runx1, decreased in cilia-impaired embryos(31015398).

Synonym.x: CBFA1, AML3, CCD, PEBP2A1, CCD1, PEBP2AA1
Functio l Summary from Literature: Runx2-II, an essential transcriptio l factor in controlling osteoblast-mediated bone formation, is downstream of Pkd1 ( 16905538).

Synonym.x: ECP54, INO80H, NMP238, PONTIN52, RVB1, TIH1, TIP49, TIP49A
Functio l Summary from Literature: Role in the pre-assembly and targeting of ciliary protein complexes. Ruvbl1 may be a major organiser of dynein arm complex assembly (29959317). Essential for cilia motility in both zebrafish and mouse, cooperating with Ruvbl2 through the assembly of ciliary ODAs and IDAs, requires Ruvbl2 for stability. Essential for the stabilization of axonemal dynein intermediate chain 1 (D I1) and D I2 in mouse,and facilitates dynein arm assembly in cytosolic foci enriched with R2TP-like complexes (29113992). Depletion of HsRuvBL1 in RPE1 cells leads to the loss of primary cilia (28574207).

Synonym.x: ECP51, INO80J, REPTIN52, RVB2, TIH2, TIP48, TIP49B
Functio l Summary from Literature: Essential for cilia motility in both zebrafish and mouse, through the assembly of ciliary ODAs and IDAs and cooperating with Ruvbl1. Interacts with Hsp90 to regulate the stability of both D I1 and D I2. Requires Ruvbl1 for stability (29113992). Interacts with HYDIN, which regulates assembly of SPEF2 to the ciliary axoneme, as it cannot be detected in the axonemes of HYDIN-mutant cells (31545650). Required for the flagellar assembly of central pair complex and peri- axonemal structure in humans (31942643).

Required for ciliary transport and sig lling. It may regulate postciliary endocytosis of constitutive GPCRs and facilitate endocytosis from the cell surface following transit through cilia, as knockdown inhibits Gli3 ciliary accumulation but retain normal length cilia (21289087).

Ciliary GPCR. Localized to the plasma membrane of neuro l cilia (10199624, 23392690). Ciliary trafficking of SSTR3 into neural cilia is promoted by TULP3. Overexpression induces premature growth of primary cilia and increases expression levels of Kif3A, IFT88 and cytoplasmatic dynein (23392690). Possible influence on cell survival and/or apoptotic processes, as well as cell cycle (18992731).

Gene Description: SSX family member 2 interacting protein [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:16509]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Centriolar satellite and microtubule anchoring protein. Interacts with PCM-1. Essential for the assembly of primary cilia and the recruitment of Cep290 to both satellites and the basal body, it also promotes the ciliary entry of the entire BBSome. Knockdown limits targeting of somatostatin receptor 3, and significantly reduces axoneme length. Possible novel cooperator of Rab8 (24356449). Binds the microtubule-nucleator gamma- tubulin complex. Knockdown of its orthologue in zebrafish, results in ciliary defects and disturbs left-right asymmetry. Microtubule anchoring role to the basal body is required for primary cilia formation (24397932).
Cells subjected to trichoplein knockdown displayed decreased levels of phosphorylated Akt in the cytoplasm, and around the ciliary base in particular (33691104).

Knockdown in RPE1 cells suporesses ciliogenesis (23435566, 28122914). Mutated in canine early reti l degeneration, suggesting a role in photoreceptor cell function (20887780).

Mutations of which may cause ciliary dyskinesia (29121203).

Also known as Tektin-t. Forms filaments in flagellar, ciliary,and axonemal microtubules. Required for normal flagellar structure and function. tektins are  the accessory structures of the flagellum (16452089).

Role in flagella assembly during spermiogenesis and is implicated in sperm motility (20378928).

Critical regulator of cilia formation and morphology (26518474). Controls ciliary proteincomposition. Recruits ciliopathy proteins MKS1, TMEM231 and TMEM237. Mutated in OFD and JBTS patients (26595381). In mice, mutations decrease cilia number and disrupt Hh sig ling. Mutations cause JBTS. Required for ciliogenesis. Mutations lead to shorter cilia, and knockdown cells show defects of ciliogenesis. It might mark vesicles en route to the base of cilium, which is known to be crucial for ciliary assembly (22282472).

CEP-290-dependent transition zone protein that facilitates cilium formation, being necessary for ciliogenesis, mutated in OFD6 (26982032).

Required for ciliogenesis. It might mark vesicles en route to the base of cilium, which is known to be crucial for ciliary assembly. Mutations cause JBTS (22282472). Mutated in OFD6 (26982032) and in Meckel syndrome MKS (21493627). Mutations or knockdown result in impaired ciliogenesis and centrosome docking. MKS module component, TMEM-218 (Tmem218), that requires CEP-290 and other MKS module components for TZ localisation and functions together with the NPHP module to facilitate ciliogenesis(26982032).

Knockdown results in a reduction of cilia formation, and perturbs localisation of components of the B9 complex at the transition zone and ciliary localisation of sig lling receptors. Required for centriolar migration to the apical membrane during cell polarisation, regulation of actin cytoskeleton remodelling and RhoA activity (26035863). Required for the elongation and mainte nce of the outer segments in reti . It may play a role in photoreceptor intraciliary transport (22247471). Mutations are a major cause of MKS, JBTS and NPHP (23393159). MKS function is required for ciliary structure and function, plays a role in regulating cilia length and number through modulating centrosome duplication (19515853). In complex with other TZ proteins, it contributes to an early ciliogenic event and establish basal body/TZ membrane attachments (21422230).

There were dysplastic arterial valve leaflets in some cases when Ift88 was deleted in the Tnnt2-Cre lineage suggesting that cilia may be required for the development of the arterial valve leaflets (40498626).

Also known as Importin beta 2. Regulated RP2 trafficking into the ciliary compartment (21285245). Interacts with KIF17, this interaction is required for the ciliary entry of KIF17 (20526328). DAF-6/intraflagellar transport and the OCR-2/OSM-9 TRPV channel act in concert, regulating two layers of activation of tph-1 in the ADF neurons. The TRPV sig ling turns on tph-1 expression under favorable and aversive conditions, whereas i ctivation of DAF-6 by stress results in further upregulation of tph-1 independently of OCR-2/OSM-9 activity. tph-1 has expression in dendritic cilia of a pair of ADF serotonergic chemosensory neurons(19339602).

Gene Description: tubulin polymerization promoting protein family member 2 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:19293]
Functio l Summary from Literature: IFT transport and sig lling defects after knockdown, ciliary frequency not affected. Candidate cilia gene.

Gene Description: translocated promoter region, nuclear basket protein [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:12017]
Functio l Summary from Literature: The TPR protein mutant oval/ift88 shows polyglutamylation extending to the tips of cilia ( 17761526).
Also known as GPR175. Positively regulates Hh sig ling via inhibiting PKA activity by lowering cAMP levels. Its ciliary localisation and activity is Hh-dependent (26451044).

Synonym.x: CFAP116, DKFZP434F124, FAP116, IFT54, MIP-T3, MIPT3
Functio l Summary from Literature: Also known as IFT54. Evolucio irly conserved role in ciliogenesis, interacts with with tubulin and actin. Mutations lead to altered cilia mediated hedgehog sig ling (21945076). Plays a critical role in IFT, as well as building and maintaining functio l cilia (18369462). IFT-B subunit which regulates ciliary composition. I ctivation is embryonic lethal and causes characteristic ciliopathy phenotypes (26487268). Interacts with and stabilises IFT20 and Rabaptin5, which in turn interacts with Rab8, suggesting a potential role for IFT in regulating the assembly of ciliary membranes. It may also participate in tubulin transport for ciliogenesis. Loss of IFT54 impairs cilia assembly as well as cytoplasmic MT dy mics (28417161). Interacts with both kinesin鈥怚I and IFT dynein and regulates anterograde IFT (33368450).
Protein complexes: Intraflagellar transport complex B, Intraflagellar transport complex B peripheral subcomplex

Gene Description: trafficking protein particle complex subunit 10 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:11868]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Component of a mammalian TRAPPII complex. Required for Rabin8 centrosomal targeting prior to ciliogenesis. Knockdown impares cilia formation by inhibiting Rabin8 recruitment to the centrosome (21273506).
Protein complexes: TRAPP complex oligomer, RAB3IP-TRAPP II complex, mTRAPP II complex

Gene Description: trafficking protein particle complex subunit 12 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:24284]
Functio l Summary from Literature: TRAPPIII components, TRAPPC8 and TRAPPC12, are in the cilium formation, and TRAPPIII regulates ciliogenesis via its interaction with a ciliopathy protein, OFD1. Depletion causes increased ciliary length because TRAPPC12 is required for the disassembly of primary cilia (32258032).

Gene Description: trafficking protein particle complex subunit 13 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:25828]
Functio l Summary from Literature: TRAPPC13 and NPHP4 are highly enriched at the base of primary cilia(27514913).

Gene Description: trafficking protein particle complex subunit 14 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:25604]
Functio l Summary from Literature: TRAPPC14 interacts with the distal appendage proteins Fas-binding factor 1 (FBF1) and centrosomal protein 83 (CEP83), which shows here are required for GFP-Rabin8 centrosomal accumulation, supporting a role for the TRAPPII complex in tethering preciliary vesicles to the mother basal body during ciliogenesis (31467083).TRAPPC14  localized to basal body (25613900)

Gene Description: trafficking protein particle complex subunit 3 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:19942]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Component of a mammalian TRAPPII complex. Required for Rabin8 centrosomal targeting prior to ciliogenesis. Knockdown impares cilia formation by inhibiting Rabin8 recruitment to the centrosome (21273506). Candidate gene for BBS (27894351).
Protein complexes: TRAPP complex oligomer, RAB3IP-TRAPP II complex, mTRAPP II complex

Gene Description: trafficking protein particle complex subunit 8 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:29169]
Functio l Summary from Literature: TRAPPIII components, TRAPPC8 and TRAPPC12, are in the cilium formation, and TRAPPIII regulates ciliogenesis via its interaction with a ciliopathy protein, OFD1. TRAPPC8 and OFD1 inhibit that between OFD1 and TRAPPC12 (32258032)

Gene Description: trafficking protein particle complex subunit 9 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:30832]
Synonym.x: IKBKBBP, KIAA1882, MRT13, NIBP, T1, TRS120
Functio l Summary from Literature: Component of a mammalian TRAPPII complex. Required for Rabin8 centrosomal targeting prior to ciliogenesis. Knockdown impares cilia formation by inhibiting Rabin8 recruitment to the centrosome (21273506).
Protein complexes: TRAPP complex oligomer, RAB3IP-TRAPP II complex, mTRAPP II complex

Functio l Summary from Literature: Directio lly selective RGCs that are CART positive or Trhr positive localize either Arl13b or AC3, respectively, in cilia ( 35434813).

I ctivating homozygous mutations cause ciliopathy BBS11 (16606853). Ubiquiti tes NPHP5 which triggers protein delocalization and loss of cilia. Loss of BBS11 causes an accumulation of NPHP5 at the centrosome (28498859).
TRIM46 localized at cilia

Gene Description: trio Rho guanine nucleotide exchange factor [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:12303]
Functio l Summary from Literature: TRIO has localized in ciliary tip, primary cilia.

Anchores IFT20 to the Golgi complex. Interacts with IFT20 and to regulate sorting and/or trafficking of proteins from Golgi to the ciliary membrane. Required for efficient targeting of polycystin-2 to the cilium. Cilia in mutant cells are shorter (19112494)
TRIP13 has localized in flagella.

The requirement for homodimerization which doubles its interaction sites, its punctate localization along the axoneme, and its co-localization with other cilia components suggest a scaffold/co-transporter function for TRIP6 in cilia(34620853).

Gene Description: transient receptor potential cation channel subfamily C member 1 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:12333]
Functio l Summary from Literature: TRPP2 and TRPC1 assemble to form a heteromeric channel with biophysical properties and modes of activation distinct from that of the individual channels. One of the physiological roles of this new channel is to mediate G-protein-coupled receptor (GPCR)-induced conductance in  tive kidney epithelial cells(18323855).

Gene Description: transient receptor potential cation channel subfamily M member 3 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:17992]
Functio l Summary from Literature: primary cilia are required for the maximal osmotic response in re l epithelial cells and that TRPM3 is involved in this mechanism and coexpression with acetylated 伪-tubulin and 纬-tubulin(28122715).

Gene Description: transient receptor potential cation channel subfamily M member 4 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:17993]
Functio l Summary from Literature: TRPM4 is likely to influence the apical Ca虏鈦

Gene Description: transient receptor potential cation channel subfamily M member 5 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:14323]
Functio l Summary from Literature: TRPM5-expressing OSNs that project axons to glomeruli in the ventral area of the main olfactory bulb are involved in processing of information from semiochemicals(17267604).

Gene Description: transient receptor potential cation channel subfamily V member 4 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:18083]
Synonym.x: CMT2C, OTRPC4, TRP12, VR-OAC, VRL-2, VROAC
Functio l Summary from Literature: Mediates Ca2+ influx in response to mechanical and osmotic stimuli in ciliated epithelia, which in turns regulates the ciliary beat frequency (18719094). Mediates oscillatory fluid shear mechanotransduction in various cells via the primary cilium (29491434).

Gene Description: transient receptor potential cation channel subfamily V member 5 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:3145]
Functio l Summary from Literature: TRPV5/6 aren't ciliary, but may work alongside cilia-regulated systems to maintain calcium balance( 15483124).

Gene Description: transient receptor potential cation channel subfamily V member 6 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:14006]
Functio l Summary from Literature: TRPV5/6 aren't ciliary, but may work alongside cilia-regulated systems to maintain calcium balance( 15483124).

Central regulator of multiciliated cells formation. Acts downstream of Notch 2 and upstream Multicilin in regulation of ciliated cell formation, binds to the promoters and regulates the expression of genes involved in multiciliated cell differentiation and function, including several genes associated with human ciliopathies like PCD. Required for FOXJ1 expression. Knockdown of TRRAP decreased the number of ciliated cells, and knockout mice are not viable (29588376).

Regulates the length of cilia. Form a complex with TSC2 that negatively regulates the nTOR pathway and, in turn, cell growth, proliferation and survival (19008302). Mutations have been associated with Tuberous sclerosis complex and polycystic kidney disease. Loss of Tsc1 or Tsc2 enhances ciliary formation and elongation (18845692). Required for activation of canonical TGF-尾 sig ling. Regulates Smoothened (SMO)- dependent HH sig ling in cilia (29396625). Role in maintaining cell polarity (19321600).

Form a complex with TSC1 that negatively regulates the TOR pathway and, in turn, cell growth, proliferation and survival (19008302).Mutations have been associated with Tuberous sclerosis complex and polycystic kidney disease. Loss of Tsc1 or Tsc2 enhances ciliary formation and elongation (18845692). Regulates Smoothened (SMO)- dependent HH sig ling in cilia (29396625). Role in maintaining cell polarity. Associates with the GSK3/axin complex to inhibit canonical Wnt-sig lling (19321600). Required for the normal trafficking of PC-1 from the Golgi to the membrane (20169078).
TSG101 itself is not a ciliary protein, but it may functio lly intersect with ciliary proteins like IFT20 outside the cilium — especially in T cells and immune sig ling ( 37029318).
Role in spermatogenesis. Possible role in the structure of primary cilium, as it was found to colocalise with gamma- tubulin in COS-1 cells (16643851).
TSGA10IP has localized in flagella.

Gene Description: testis specific serine ki se 1B [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:14968]
Functio l Summary from Literature: TSSK1B has localized in basal body, transition zone.

Regulator of the initiation of ciliogenesis in vivo. Ttbk2 mutants lack cilia. Promotes the removal of CP110 from the mother centriole, the recruitment and retention of IFT proteins at the distal end of basal body, to initiate the assembly of the ciliary axoneme (23141541). Mutations have been associated with domi nt human neurodegenerative disorder Spinocerebellar Ataxia type 11 (18037885). Interacts in a complex with CP164, which is required for its ciliary localisation. Promotes assembly of distal appendages at both centrioles and Cep83 localisation (24982133). Phosphorylates Cep164, Cep97 and inhibits the interaction between Cep164 and Dvl3 (25297623). Phosphorylated CEP83, which is required for ciliary vesicle docking and CP110 removal (31455668). Remains at the transition zone of the cilium following ciliogenesis, to regulate cilium stability (30532139).

Centrosome component (23300604). Involved in the assembly and/or transport of axonemal dynein arms. Loss of function affects both ODA and IDA. In paramecia, knockdown led to the absence of dynein arms (31978331).
Interacts with C2orf62 and regulates ciliogenesis and actin polymerisation in ciliated cells. Depletion reduces the number of primary cilia but does not alter their length (24475127).

Synonym.x: CFAP60, FAP60, FLA17, FLJ11457, IFT139, IFT139B, JBTS11, NPHP12, THM1
Functio l Summary from Literature: Encodes a retrograde intraflagellar transport-A complex, associates with the motor protein dynein2 to regulate retrograde trafficking in the primary cilium. Knockdown induces microtubule anchoring defects (24876116). Mutated in nephronophthisis, syndromic Jeune Asphyxiating Thoracic Dystrophy (21258341), Focal Segmental glomerulosclerosis (24876116) and Joubert Syndrome (29615573).

Mutated in OFD. TTC23 localizes to the shaft of the cilia in controls but is restricted mainly to the base of the cilia in patient fibroblasts. Patient fibroblasts show normal ciliogenesis but increased length of cilia compared with control (32055034). Affinity purification and mass spectrometry show TTC23 to strongly associate with IQCE and EFCAB7, components of the Ellis鈥搗an Creveld (EvC) zone (29459677)

Also known as NYD-SP14. Strongly expressed in tissues with motile cilia and flagella. Functions in cilia and flagella, most likely as an inner-arm dynein subunit. Chlamydomo s homologue encodes 44kDa subunit of axonemal dynein (17981992). Involved in functio l interaction with the IFT machinery, participating in anterograde IFT. Mutations have been associated with multiple morphological abnormalities of the flagella (31735294).
TTC36 mainly interacted with IFT-A complex(25860617).

TTC39c has weak association with IFT144 and IFT139, two subunits of IFT-A(25860617). TTC39A/C and TMEM145 are localized to the cilia of sensory neurons in the head (amphid) and tail (phasmid) of C. elegans (38989623).
TTC4 and TTC9c interacted specifically with BBS7 (25860617).
Mutated in MKS. TTC6 localizes to the centrosome and ciliary shaft in controls but only to the centrosome in patient fibroblasts (32055034)

Also known as BBS8. Component of the BBSome complex, interacts with PCM1. Mutations leads to Bardet-Biedl syndrome with randomization of left-right body axis symmetry (14520415). Role in intraciliary/flagellar transport, coordi ting the velocity of the kinesin molecular motors during anterograde transport. Interacts with Vangl2 to establish and maintain of vertebrate left-right asymmetry. It may also be responsible for maintaining normal cilium length in the KV but not cilia number (20643117). Required for the development, mainte nce and survival of photoreceptors and outer segments in both rods and cones (29126234). Knockdown reduces ciliary length and increases levels of HDAC6 (30446775).
TTC4 and TTC9c interacted specifically with BBS7 (25860617).

Ciliated metaplasia (CM) is associated with the expression of TTF-1 and HFH-4. Furthermore, TTF-1 expression was found in non-ciliated cells in 50% of cases with atrophic gastritis, whereas TTF-1 and HFH-4 were not expressed in normal gastric mucosa or in non-atrophic gastritis ( 15912575).

Also known as MPS1. Negative regulator of ciliogenesis. Interacts with VDAC3 at the centrosome to promote ciliary disassembly during cell cycle entry and proliferation. Essential for the recruitment of Centrin 2 to the procentrioles (23388454).

TTL controls microtubule modification and thereby indirectly regulates ciliogenesis and ciliary structure, but TTL itself is not physically located inside or on the cilium. It acts upstream by modifying α-tubulin, which cilia need to build their structure ( 35903547).

Gene Description: TTL family tubulin polyglutamylase complex subunit L1 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:1312]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Involved in the post- translatio l polyglutamylation of tubulin in axonemal microtubules within cilia and flagella, this glutamylation is required to generate a curved cilia waveform. Essential for normal motility of respiratory ciliary and for the biogenesis and integrity of sperm flagella, as PCD phenotype is seen in KO mice (20442420).
TTLL10 produces R-polygly-recognized microtubules when co-expressed with TTLL8(28576883).
Ttll1p showed a chain-initiating activity and disruption of the TTLL1 and TTLL9 genes decreased the rates of cell multiplication and phagocytosis(18586949).

TTLL12 localizes to the base of primary cilia and is required for cilia formation in polarized re l epithelial cells. TTLL12 directly binds to the 伪/尾-tubulin heterodimer in vitro and regulates microtubule dy mics, stability, and post-translatio l modifications (PTMs)(37546873).
TTLL13 has localized in basal body.

Functions in posttranslatio l glycylation of microtubules. Required for either elongation or stability of axonemes (19531357). Depletion leads to shortening and loss of axonemes (21262966). Required for primary cilia formation and control of cell proliferation. Only glycylase expressed in colon (25180231).
TTLL4 is present in cilia and in some cells also at the basal bodies (17499049).

Recruited by ARL13B and FIP5 (30120249). Higher activity initiating glutamate chains than elongating them. Required for RPGRORF15 function as it seems to be highly selective (27162334). Essential for the correct function of sperm flagella. It might also be responsible for the tubulin polyglutami tion in the microtubule triplets of the centrioles, increasing the centriole stability. Mutations have been identified as cause of recessive reti l dystrophy (24791901), and reduced sperm motility and infertility in humans (28173158).

Main axonemal tubulin glutamylase of ciliated cells. Knockdown caused loss of axonemal glutamylation but not basal body glutamylation (21262966). Ciliary entry and distribution of TTLL6 is regulated by CEP41 (22246503). Critical in the regulation of axonemal motility and ciliary beating in ependymal cells, as it cannot be replaced by any of the other glutamylases (23897886).
TTLL7 localize to both basal bodies and cilia(17499049).

It may function in initiating glygylation modification by attaching the first glycine to tubulin. Interacts with TTLL10 and is required for TTLL10 efficient tubulin glycylation function (19427864). Redundant function with TTLL3, as both are unique monoglycylating enzymes in mammals. Required for stability and mainte nce of motile ependymal cilia. Absence of TTL3 leads to absence of glycylation on axonemes, destabilising motile ependymal cilia and resulting in ciliary disassembly (23897886, 25180231).
伪-tubulin glutamylase required for the elongation of the polyglutamate side chains, and for the normal assembly and function of cilia (18586949, 20188560).
Mutations have been associated with reti l and cochlear degeneration, as well as obesity (24375934). Function in ciliary GPCR trafficking in a similar way to TULP3 (28154160).
Alfa tubulin isoform. Component of the cytoskeleton, centrosomes and protofilaments, structures that associate laterally to form a microtubule.
TUBA1B has localized in primary cilia.
Alfa tubulin isoform. Component of the cytoskeleton, centrosomes and protofilaments, structures that associate laterally to form a microtubule.
TUBA3C has localized in primary cilia.
TUBA3D has localized in primary cilia.
TUBA3E has localized in primary cilia.
Alfa tubulin isoform. Component of the cytoskeleton, centrosomes and protofilaments, structures that associate laterally to form a microtubule.
TUBB has localized in basal body.
TUBB1 has localized in basal body.
Beta tubulin isoform. Component of the cytoskeleton, centrosomes and protofilaments, structures that associate laterally to form a microtubule.
Beta tubulin isoform. Component of the cytoskeleton, centrosomes and protofilaments, structures that associate laterally to form a microtubule.
Beta tubulin isoform. Component of the cytoskeleton, centrosomes and protofilaments, structures that associate laterally to form a microtubule.
Tubb4 protein, Tubb4a and Tubb4b, is localized to cilia in multiple lineages of multi-ciliated cells (MCCs) (38031972).

Beta tubulin isoform. Component of the cytoskeleton, centrosomes and protofilaments, structures that associate laterally to form a microtubule. Mutations in TUBB4B Cause a Distinctive Sensorineural Disease of LCA with hearing loss
TUBB6 has localized in basal body.
TUBB8 has localized in basal body.
TUBB8B has localized in cilia.

Interacts with delta-tubulin to form the triplet microtubules or to stabilize them against depolymerization (28906251). Function in the centriole lumen and on the cytoplasmic side is essential for the centriole-to- centrosome conversion. Depletion of TUBE1 affects microtubules biogenesis and reduces CEP44 recruitment to centrioles (11148142).
TUBG1 has localized in flagella.
TUBG2 has localized in flagella.

Also known as GCP2. Gamma tubulin complex protein. These type of complexes of gamma-tubulin are used as templates for the longitudi l association with 伪/尾-tubulin dimers during the nucleation process (29514869). Component of gamma- tubulin small complexes that then associate with associate with GCP4, GCP5 and GCP6 to form ring complexes (21725292).

Also known as GCP3. Gamma tubulin complex protein. These type of complexes of gamma-tubulin are used as templates for the longitudi l association with 伪/尾-tubulin dimers during the nucleation process (29514869). Component of gamma- tubulin small complexes that then associate with associate with GCP4, GCP5 and GCP6 to form ring complexes (21725292).

Also known as GCP4. Required for the initial assembly of gamma-tubulin ring complexes and for their stabilization after assembly. These complexes are used as templates for the longitudi l association with 伪/尾-tubulin dimers during the nucleation process (29514869, 32317396). Associates with gamma-tubulin small complexes, GCP5 and GCP6 (21725292). Mutations have been identified in patients with autosomal- recessive microcephaly and chorioretinopathy. Role in mainte nce of reti l homeostasis, through participating in assembly of gamma- TuRC (31209365).

Also known as GCP5. Required for the initial assembly of gamma-tubulin ring complexes and for their stabilization after assembly. These complexes are used as templates for the longitudi l association with 伪/尾-tubulin dimers during the nucleation process (29514869, 32317396). Associates with gamma-tubulin small complexes, GCP4 and GCP6 (21725292).

Also known as GCP6. Required for the initial assembly of gamma-tubulin ring complexes and for their stabilization after assembly. These complexes are used as templates for the longitudi l association with 伪/尾-tubulin dimers during the nucleation process (29514869, 32317396). Associates with gamma-tubulin small complexes, GCP4 and GCP5 (21725292).

Role in intracellular transport, cell differentiation, sig ling, and motility. Mutations result in progressive photoreceptor degeneration in mice and retinitis pigmentosa in humans (33187986, 25074776, 9462750).

Role in intracellular transport, cell differentiation, sig ling, and motility (33187986). Associates with IFT-A in a complex to regulate trafficking and localisation of G protein-coupled receptors into cilia. Negative regulator of Hedgehog sig ling (20889716). Adapter for ciliary trafficking of membrane cargo, regulates PC1/2 complex trafficking (28154160). Required for proper Shh-dependent limb patterning, as it inhibits Gli2 activity (19286674). Essential for trafficking of Arl13b and INPP5E into cilia. Loss of function causes ciliopathy-associated polycystic kidney disease, downregulates the formation of cilia and their length (30799240, 30583862).
Mutated in patients with Meckel-Gruber syndrome (27894351, 30851085, 31411728). Loss of TXNDC15 prevented correct localization of the TMEM67 ciliary receptor to the transition zone (27894351).

Functio l Summary from Literature: UBE2B localized to flagella (25613900)

Functio l Summary from Literature: Correct 尾-catenin levels are tightly regulated at the primary cilium by a ciliary-specific E2 (UBE2E1) and a regulatory substrate-adaptor (MKS1)(35170427).

Gene Description: ubiquitin conjugating enzyme E2 L3 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:12488]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Ube2l3 must be localized to cilia to function in regulating the ciliary levels of Smo (34161574).

Gene Description: ubiquitin conjugating enzyme E2 L5 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:13477]
Functio l Summary from Literature: UBE2L5 has localized in cilia.

NIM1K and UBL3 localize inside the cilium in a prenylation-dependent manner and UBL3 also localizes in vesicle-like structures around the base of the cilium. Through affinity proteomics of UBL3, it confirmed its strong interaction with PDE6D and its association with proteins that regulate small extracellular vesicles (sEVs) and ciliogenesis (36672247).

Gene Description: ubiquitin protein ligase E3 component n-recognin 4 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:30313]
Functio l Summary from Literature: UBR4 has localized in basal body,flagella.

Gene Description: ubiquitin protein ligase E3 component n-recognin 5 [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:16806]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Positive regulator of ciliogenesis. Ubiquitylates CSPP1 and is required for cytoplasmic organisation of CSPP1-associated centriolar satellites in centrosomal periphery. Regulates ciliogenesis via mainte nce of centriolar satellite stability and CSPP1 localisation (29742019).
Facilitates recruitment of VCP to IFT-B. Interaction with VCP is required for UBXN10 ciliary localisation. Depletion of UBXN10 in zebrafish causes defects in left-right asymmetry (26389662).
A subset of these receptors, such as ODR-10, requires the odr-4 and odr-8 genes to be appropriately localized to sensory cilia (24603482)
UGGT1 localized at cilia

Gene Description: UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 2 member A1 complex locus [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:12542]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Treatment of the OE with beta-glucuronidase, an enzyme which counterbalance the UGTs activity, increased the response to eugenol which is a strong odorant UGT substrate(33765098).

Hydrocephalus due to dysfunctio l motile cilia in KO mouse, suggesting it may be involved in the development and/or function of motile cilia in the respiratory tract and ependyma (21746835). Essential for Ciliogenesis and CSF Flow. Modulates expression of the master regulator of ciliogenesis, Foxj1,its target genes and other ciliogenesis molecules, influencing axoneme structure, basal body alignment, cilia number and beating. Implicated in ciliopathy-related disorders (27445138).

Mutations are responsible for medullary cystic kidney disease type 2 (15029248), familial juvenile hyperuricemic nephropathy and glomerulocystic kidney disease. Expressed in re l primary cilia. UMOD mutations result in decreased ciliary uromodulin expression and delayed ER to Golgi trafficking (20172860 ).

UNC119 bound T伪-GTP, inhibiting its GTPase activity, thereby providing a stable UNC119鈥揟伪-GTP complex capable of diffusing from the inner segment back to the outer segment after light-induced translocation. UNC119 is a G伪 subunit cofactor essential for G protein trafficking in sensory cilia(21642972). nphp-2 (the C. elegans Inversin homolog) and the doublet region genes arl-13, klp-11, and unc-119 are redundantly required for ciliogenesis(25501555).

Gene Description: unc-119 lipid binding chaperone B [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:16488]
Functio l Summary from Literature: ARL3 effector UNC119 as a binding partner of the myristoylated ciliopathy protein nephrocystin-3 (NPHP3). Binding of ARL3-GTP serves to release myristoylated cargo from UNC119.
SLC38A4 exhibited an opposite regulatory trend in ARL3T31A and ARL3T31A/C118F groups, while IQUB, UNC13D, RAB3IP, and GRIP1 were specifically downregulated in the ARL3T31A/C118F group ( 38457249).

Gene Description: USH1 protein network component harmonin [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:12597]
Synonym.x: AIE-75, DFNB18, HARMONIN, NY-CO-37, NY-CO-38, PDZ-73, PDZ73, PDZD7C
Functio l Summary from Literature: Interacts with DOCK4 to regulate actin cytoskeleton organisation in stereocilia. Mutation are associated with Usher syndrome type 1c (16464467). Binds to myosin VIIa,cadherin 23 and F-actin (12588794).

Gene Description: USH1 protein network component sans [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:16356]
Functio l Summary from Literature: Ciliopathy gene OMIM: 607696. Mutation are associated with Usher syndrome type 1g. Associates with harmonin and is involved in the functio l network formed through it (12588794). Required for outer segment differentiation, formation and mainte nce of reti  and photoreceptor cell polarity. Scaffold protein in the USH network during ciliogenesis, as dysfunction leads to reti l degeneration (17923142). Form a complex with myomegalin, cooperating in the vesicle transport towards the ciliary base of photoreceptor cells (21767579). Interacts directly with IFT-B proteins, IFT20, IFT52, IFT57, and IFT74, ISHG1 may control the transport of these molecules to the ciliary base (31637240).

MIM: 608400 (10738000) Required for the long-term mainte nce of reti l photoreceptors (17360538). Interacts and colocalises with Nlp and lebercilin at the centrosome (18826961). Interacts with SPAG5 and NINL to regulate microtubule-based cytoplasmic trafficking of proteins required for ciliogenesis, mainte nce and/or function, to the apical inner segment and basal body of photoreceptor. Mutations are associated withnon- syndromic retinitis pigmentosa and Usher syndrome (23351521).
USP11 staining was observed in the cytoplasm and cilia(31835165).

Deubiquiti ting enzyme. Regulator of the ubiquitin proteasome system that controls controls ciliogenesis and cilium elongation, it positively affects Hh sig lling through the degradation of Kif7. Controls Gli2 ciliary localisation ( 30388222).
Loss of USP21 leads to the proteasomal degradation of DPYSL2 and causes a significant reduction in its centrosome abundance, ultimately resulting in ciliary defects (40619097).
USP33 interacts with CP110 and localizes to centrioles primarily in S and G2/M phases, the periods during which centrioles duplicate and elongate(23486064).

USP35 (and its orthologue USP38) showed that suppression or ablation in vivo rescued a host of ciliopathy-associated a tomical pathologies, with concomitant rescue of the overabundance of key sig ling molecules ( 31723061).

USP35 (and its orthologue USP38) showed that suppression or ablation in vivo rescued a host of ciliopathy-associated a tomical pathologies, with concomitant rescue of the overabundance of key sig ling molecules ( 31723061).

Endogenous USP48 localises to the basal body in reti l cells and provide data that supports the function of USP48 in the photoreceptor cilium. USP48 interacts with the IRD-associated proteins ARL3 and UNC119a, and stabilise their protein levels using different mechanisms.

Binds to, stabilises and deubiquiti tes HIF1伪 to control ciliogenesis, maintaining a basal expression of HIF1伪 (24378640). Recruited by SUMOylated Smo to antagonise Smo ubiquiti tion and degradation, leading to increased Hh pathway activity (27746045). USP8 phosphorylation by EGFR is essential for suppression of ciliogenesis, indicating that mutations or lack of USP8 function may cause ciliopathies through elongation of primary cilia (29472535).

Deubiquiti ting enzyme localised to centrosome, involved in context-dependent ciliogenesis. Regulates level of ubiquiti tion of NPHP5 to control ciliogenesis. In the G0/G1/S phase, USP9X is recruited to the centrosome by NPHP5, and later protects NPHP5 from ubiquiti tion, promoting cilia assembly. In the G2/M phase, USP9X dissociates from the centrosome allowing BBS11 to K63 ubiquiti te NPHP5, triggering loss of cilia. Works with two E3 ubiquitin ligases BBS11/TRIM32 and MARCHF7 (28498859). Binds and stabilises PCM1 to prevent its degradation and regulate centriolar satellite integrity. Regulates centrosome duplication (30584065). During Serum- Starvation-Induced Ciliogenesis, it is recruited by SNX17 to antagonize MIB1- Mediated Ubiquiti tion and Degradation of PCM1 (31671755).
UTRN has localized in ciliary tip, basal body, transition zone.

Regulator of protein quality control and ubiquitin-mediated sig ling. Interacts wiith UBXN10 to control its localisation to cilia. VCP and UBXN10 interaction is also required for ciliogenesis and mainte nce of cilia (26389662).

Centrosomal VDAC1 is predomi ntly localized to the mother centriole, while VDAC2 localizes to centriolar satellites in a microtubule-dependent manner. Down-regulation of VDAC1 leads to i ppropriate ciliogenesis, while its overexpression suppresses cilia formation(26264029).

Centrosomal VDAC1 is predomi ntly localized to the mother centriole, while VDAC2 localizes to centriolar satellites in a microtubule-dependent manner. VDAC2 appears to promote maturation of primary cilia(26264029).

Required for the mainte nce of axonemes of sperm, absence of VDAC3 in the mouse leads to defective axonemal structures in sperm and immotility (11507092). Modulates centriole assembly by recruites Mps1 to centrosomes. VDAC3-Mps1 interaction promotes ciliary disassembly during cell cycle entry and prevents cilia assembly in proliferating cells (23388454, 26264029).

MIM: 193300, MIM: 144700, MIM: 171300, MIM: 263400, Somatic i ctivation of VHL causes re l and pancreatic cysts associated with cilia loss. Stabilises microtubule dy mics in the axoneme (17450132). Interacts with KIF3A and kinesin鈥

The C-terminus of VPAC2 is sufficient to target a non-ciliary membrane protein to cilia, and the BBSome (a complex of Bardet鈥揃iedl syndrome proteins), the BBSome targeting factor Arl6 and Tubby are important for ciliary targeting of endogenous VPAC2(25369807).

Gene Description: WD repeat containing pla r cell polarity effector [Source:HGNC Symbol,Acc:HGNC:28027]
Functio l Summary from Literature: MIM: 613580. Also known as C2ORF86, BBS15 or FRITZ. Regulates pla r cell polarity through the modulation of the actin cytoskeleton. Required for recruitment of proteins essential for ciliogenesis to the transition zone, including Sept2, Nphp1, and Mks1, and facilitates the assembly of multiprotein complexes. Mutations have been associated with Bardet-Biedl and and Meckel-Gruber syndromes (24302887, 32055034). Knockdown leads to fewer and shorter cilia and decreses the expression of Septin7 in human  sal epithelium, indication that Septin7 could be a target of WDPCP (28001338). Regulates cilia function and beating through activation of MAPK/ERK pathway in the mitochondria of sino sal epithelial cells (33598458).

Functio l Summary from Literature: Modulates the Hedgehog (Hh) sig lling pathway and is essential for ciliogenesis. It may be required for cilia extension and growth. Interacts with ciliary components involved in human ciliopathies such as BBSomes and IFT proteins. Shuttles between cilium and nucleus in response to Shh sig lling. Implicated in congenital hypogo dotropic hypogo dism (CHH) and Kallmann syndrome (KS), characterised by delayed puberty and infertility (29263200).
Wdr18 is required for Kupffer's vesicle formation and regulation of body asymmetry in zebrafish ( 21876750).

Functio l Summary from Literature: Also known as IFT144. Retrograde IFT-A protein. Ortholog of C.elegans DYF-2 (16957054). Mutations can also cause disorganization of microtubules in sperm flagella and nonsyndromic asthenoteratospermia (32323121)
WDR27 colocalize with cilia in HK2 cells(28460059).

WDR-31, together with RP-2 and ELMD-1 results in ciliary accumulations of IFT Complex B components and KIF17 kinesin, with fewer IFT/BBSome particles traveling along cilia in both anterograde and retrograde directions, suggesting that the IFT/BBSome entry into the cilia and exit from the cilia are impacted(37208194).

IFT complex A component, endogenous WDR35 localizes to cilia and centrosomes throughout the developing embryo and human and mouse fibroblasts lacking the protein fail to produce cilia. Human and mouse homozygouse mutations in WDR35 cause ciliopathy short-rib polydactyly syndrome (22987818). Heterozygous mutations shown to cause cranioectodermal dysplasia-2. OMIM:613602. Interacts with RagA, mTORC1 activator (30570184)
WDR4 loss-of-function impairs head growth and neurogenesis via aberrant cilia formation, initially caused by disturbed protein and ubiquitin homeostasis ( 39251572).

Rab11 binding protein, negatively regulates ciliogenesis. Akt phosphorylates WDR44 at Ser342/344 to stabilise it and increase its binding to Rab11, which prevents ciliogenesis. WDR44 depletion promotes binding of Rab11a to Rabin8, which leads to preciliary trafficking and ciliogenesis- initiating events at the mother centriole. Disruption of Akt sig ling causes a switch from Rab11-WDR44 to the Rab11-FIP3-Rabin8 complex which promotes ciliogenesis(31204173) Endosomal protein phosphorylated by Akt at Ser346 (31665227)
Wdr47, Camsaps, and Katanin function together for the generation of non-centrosomal microtubule arrays in polarized subcellular compartments(34608154).
WDR49 has localized in cilia.

Stabilizes actin architecture to promote multiciliated cell formation (30205038). Regulates FOXJ1 expression to control ciliogenesis at the node and LR patterning. De novo change in patient with CHD and heterotaxy (30377171)
WDR54 is indeed in the cilia of human RPE1 cells and WDR54 localize to the cilia of sensory neurons of the head and tails in C. elegans(38989623).

Truncating, frameshift or missense mutations cause primary autosomal recessive microcephaly type 2 (OMIM:613583). WDR62 ablation leads to retarded cilium disassembly, long cilium, and delayed cell cycle progression leading to decreased proliferation and premature differentiation of neural progenitor cells (31197141). Localises to mitotic spindle poles with paralog MAPKBP1 (28089251). Localises to the basal body. MIssense mutants localise to basal body but fail to recruit CPAP and IFT88 (31816041)

The avian influenza virus that targets ciliated cells modulates the expression of WDR93, a central ciliary apparatus C1d projection component ( 37621660).

DFNB31/whirlin. PDZ scaffold protein. Mutated in autosomal recessive non-syndromic deafness type 31 (12833159) and Usher syndrome type 2D (PMID:17171570) in humans (OMIM 607928). Only the whirlin long isoform (with an additio l N-termi l PDZ domain) is expressed in the reti , the reti  is affected if this extra PDZ domain is mutated (20502675). Localises to the tiip of the ssterocilium of the cochlear hair cell (15590698). Interacts directly with USH2A and VLGR1 in the connecting cilium of photoreceptor cells (16434480). Interacts with L-type calcium channel subunit Ca(v)1.3 (alpha(1D) at synpase in reti  (19959638). Interacts with RPGR(ORF15) in the photoreceptors (22323458)

Opposing gradients of Wnt5a and Wnt5b and of their Sfrp inhibitors, together with intercellular sig ling via PCP proteins, polarize node cells along the anterior-posterior axis for breaking of left-right symmetry ( 28292423).
